"Content": "# https://docs.sunoapi.org - Full Content\n\n> Api documents\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/create-music-video\n\n# Create Music Video - Suno API\n\nCreate Music Video\n\nMusic Video Generation\n\nGenerate an MP4 video with visualizations for a music track.\n\n### Usage Guide\n\n*   This endpoint creates a visual representation of your music track as an MP4 video\n*   Both taskId and audioId are required to identify the specific track\n*   Optional author and domainName parameters can be used to add branding\n\n### Developer Notes\n\n1.  Generated video files are retained for 15 days\n2.  Videos include visual effects synchronized with the music\n3.  This feature is ideal for social media sharing, music promotion, or creating visual content\n4.  Videos maintain the same audio quality as the original track\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n## ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\ntaskId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe task ID of the music generation task.\n\n*   Required. This identifies the task containing the audio to be converted to video.\n*   Both `taskId` and `audioId` are needed to identify the exact track.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"taskId_774b9aa0422f\"`\n\naudioId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe ID of the specific track to convert to video.\n\n*   Required. This identifies which specific track within the task to convert.\n*   Both `taskId` and `audioId` are needed to identify the exact track.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"e231****-****-****-****-****8cadc7dc\"`\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive video generation completion notification.\n\n*   Required.\n*   The callback will include a single downloadable URL for the generated MP4 video.\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Music Video Generation Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/create-music-video-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the get music video details endpoint to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\nauthor\n\nstring\n\nThe artist or creator name to display on the video.\n\n*   Optional.\n*   Will be shown prominently in the video, typically at the beginning.\n*   Maximum 50 characters.\n\nMaximum string length: `50`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Suno Artist\"`\n\ndomainName\n\nstring\n\nThe website or brand to display as watermark.\n\n*   Optional.\n*   Will appear as a subtle watermark at the bottom of the video.\n*   Maximum 50 characters.\n\nMaximum string length: `50`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"music.example.com\"`\n\nRequest successful\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n## Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 409 - Conflict - Mp4 record already exists\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options\n\n:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`409`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Get Audio Separation Details](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-vocal-separation-details)[Music Video Generation Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/create-music-video-callbacks)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/convert-to-wav-format\n\n# Convert to WAV Format - Suno API\n\nConvert to WAV Format\n\nWAV Conversion\n\nConvert existing music tracks to high-quality WAV format.\n\n### Usage Guide\n\n*   Provide either taskId or audioId to identify the source track\n*   WAV format is ideal for professional audio editing and production\n*   The conversion preserves full audio quality\n\n### Developer Notes\n\n1.  Generated WAV files are retained for 15 days\n2.  WAV files are significantly larger than MP3 files\n3.  This format is recommended for further audio processing or professional use\n4.  Callback provides a single download URL when conversion is complete\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n## ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\ntaskId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe task ID of the music generation task.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"5c79****be8e\"`\n\naudioId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe audio ID of the specific track to convert.\n\n*   Providing the specific `audioId` ensures the exact track is converted, especially when a task has multiple tracks.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"e231****-****-****-****-****8cadc7dc\"`\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive WAV conversion completion notification.\n\n*   Required.\n*   The callback includes a single download URL for the converted WAV file.\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [WAV Format Conversion Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/convert-to-wav-format-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the get WAV conversion details endpoint to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\nRequest successful\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n## Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 409 - Conflict - WAV record already exists\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options\n\n:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`409`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Get Lyrics Generation Details](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-lyrics-generation-details)[WAV Format Conversion Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/convert-to-wav-format-callbacks)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/cover-suno\n\n# Generate Music Cover - Suno API\n\nCreate Suno Cover Task\n\nGenerate Music\n\nCreate personalized cover images for generated music.\n\n### Usage Guide\n\n*   Use this interface to create personalized cover images for generated music\n*   Requires the taskId of the original music task\n*   Each music task can only generate a Cover once; duplicate requests will return the existing taskId\n*   Results will be notified through the callback URL upon completion\n\n### Parameter Details\n\n*   `taskId` identifies the unique identifier of the original music generation task\n*   `callBackUrl` receives callback address for completion notifications\n\n### Developer Notes\n\n*   Cover image file URLs will be retained for 14 days\n*   If a Cover has already been generated for this music task, a 400 status code and existing taskId will be returned\n*   Itâ€™s recommended to call this interface after music generation is complete\n*   Usually generates 2 different style images for selection\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n## ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\ntaskId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nOriginal music task ID, should be the taskId returned by the music generation interface.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"73d6128b3523a0079df10da9471017c8\"`\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nURL address for receiving Cover generation task completion updates. This parameter is required for all Cover generation requests.\n\n*   The system will send POST requests to this URL when Cover generation is complete, including task status and results\n*   Your callback endpoint should be able to accept JSON payloads containing cover image URLs\n*   For detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Cover Generation Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/cover-suno-callbacks)\n*   Alternatively, you can use the Get Cover Details interface to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\nSuccess\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\nStatus code\n\nAvailable options\n\n:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`402`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`409`,\n\n`422`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nExample:\n\n`200`\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nStatus message\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Boost Music Style](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/boost-music-style)[Music Cover Generation Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/cover-suno-callbacks)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/convert-to-wav-format-callbacks\n\n# WAV Format Conversion Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the WAV Format Conversion API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   WAV format conversion task completed successfully\n*   WAV format conversion task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - WAV format conversion completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, unsupported source audio file format, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download source audio file\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.audioWavUrl\n\nstring\n\nConverted WAV audio file download URL, returned on success\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/wav-conversion-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received WAV format conversion callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('WAV format conversion completed');\n    console.log(`WAV file URL: ${data.audioWavUrl}`);\n    \n    // Download WAV file\n    if (data.audioWavUrl) {\n      const https = require('https');\n      const fs = require('fs');\n      \n      const filename = `wav_${data.task_id}.wav`;\n      const file = fs.createWriteStream(filename);\n      \n      https.get(data.audioWavUrl, (response) => {\n        response.pipe(file);\n        file.on('finish', () => {\n          file.close();\n          console.log(`WAV file saved as ${filename}`);\n        });\n      }).on('error', (err) => {\n        console.error('WAV file download failed:', err.message);\n      });\n    }\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('WAV format conversion failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or unsupported source file format');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('Source audio file download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/wav-conversion-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    audioWavUrl = callback_data.get('audioWavUrl')\n    \n    print(f\"Received WAV format conversion callback: {task_id}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"WAV format conversion completed\")\n        print(f\"WAV file URL: {audioWavUrl}\")\n        \n        # Download WAV file example\n        if audioWavUrl:\n            try:\n                response = requests.get(audioWavUrl)\n                if response.status_code == 200:\n                    filename = f\"wav_{task_id}.wav\"\n                    with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                        f.write(response.content)\n                    print(f\"WAV file saved as {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"WAV file download failed: {e}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"WAV format conversion failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or unsupported source file format\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"Source audio file download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$audioWavUrl = $callbackData['audioWavUrl'] ?? '';\n\nerror_log(\"Received WAV format conversion callback: $taskId, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"WAV format conversion completed\");\n    error_log(\"WAV file URL: $audioWavUrl\");\n    \n    // Download WAV file example\n    if ($audioWavUrl) {\n        try {\n            $wavContent = file_get_contents($audioWavUrl);\n            if ($wavContent !== false) {\n                $filename = \"wav_{$taskId}.wav\";\n                file_put_contents($filename, $wavContent);\n                error_log(\"WAV file saved as $filename\");\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"WAV file download failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"WAV format conversion failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or unsupported source file format\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"Source audio file download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get WAV conversion details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-wav-conversion-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/cover-suno-callbacks\n\n# Music Cover Generation Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a cover generation task to the Suno API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set the callback URL. When the task is complete, the system will automatically push results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Cover generation task completed successfully\n*   Cover generation task failed\n*   Error occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is complete, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl`:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Request processed successfully\n\n400\n\nValidation error - Request parameters invalid\n\n408\n\nRate limited - Timeout\n\n500\n\nServer error - Unexpected error occurred while processing request\n\n501\n\nCover generation failed\n\n531\n\nServer error - Sorry, generation failed due to an issue. Your credits have been refunded. Please try again\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing more detailed status description\n\ndata.taskId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.images\n\narray\n\nArray of generated cover image URLs, returned on success. Usually contains 2 different style cover images\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in common programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   Java\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/suno-cover-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received cover generation callback:', {\n    taskId: data.taskId,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Cover generation completed');\n    const images = data.images;\n    \n    if (images && images.length > 0) {\n      console.log('Generated cover images:');\n      images.forEach((imageUrl, index) => {\n        console.log(`Cover ${index + 1}: ${imageUrl}`);\n      });\n      \n      // Process cover images\n      // Can download images, save locally, update database, etc.\n      downloadImages(images, data.taskId);\n    }\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Cover generation failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\n// Download images function\nasync function downloadImages(imageUrls, taskId) {\n  const fs = require('fs');\n  const path = require('path');\n  const https = require('https');\n  \n  // Create directory\n  const dir = `covers/${taskId}`;\n  if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) {\n    fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });\n  }\n  \n  for (let i = 0; i < imageUrls.length; i++) {\n    const url = imageUrls[i];\n    const filename = path.join(dir, `cover_${i + 1}.png`);\n    \n    try {\n      await downloadFile(url, filename);\n      console.log(`Cover saved: ${filename}`);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(`Download failed: ${error.message}`);\n    }\n  }\n}\n\nfunction downloadFile(url, filename) {\n  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {\n    const file = fs.createWriteStream(filename);\n    https.get(url, (response) => {\n      response.pipe(file);\n      file.on('finish', () => {\n        file.close();\n        resolve();\n      });\n    }).on('error', (err) => {\n      fs.unlink(filename, () => {}); // Delete failed file\n      reject(err);\n    });\n  });\n}\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\nimport os\nfrom urllib.parse import urlparse\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/suno-cover-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('taskId')\n    images = callback_data.get('images')\n    \n    print(f\"Received cover generation callback: {task_id}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Cover generation completed\")\n        \n        if images:\n            print(\"Generated cover images:\")\n            for i, image_url in enumerate(images, 1):\n                print(f\"Cover {i}: {image_url}\")\n            \n            # Download cover images\n            download_images(images, task_id)\n            \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Cover generation failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\ndef download_images(image_urls, task_id):\n    \"\"\"Download cover images\"\"\"\n    # Create directory\n    dir_path = f\"covers/{task_id}\"\n    os.makedirs(dir_path, exist_ok=True)\n    \n    for i, url in enumerate(image_urls, 1):\n        try:\n            # Get file extension\n            parsed_url = urlparse(url)\n            file_ext = os.path.splitext(parsed_url.path)[1] or '.png'\n            filename = os.path.join(dir_path, f\"cover_{i}{file_ext}\")\n            \n            # Download file\n            response = requests.get(url, stream=True)\n            if response.status_code == 200:\n                with open(filename, 'wb') as f:\n                    for chunk in response.iter_content(chunk_size=8192):\n                        f.write(chunk)\n                print(f\"Cover saved: {filename}\")\n            else:\n                print(f\"Download failed {url}: HTTP {response.status_code}\")\n                \n        except Exception as e:\n            print(f\"Download failed {url}: {e}\")\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n/**\n * @param request Callback request\n * @return ResponseEntity\n * @author zj\n * @description Handle Suno Cover generation callback\n * @date 2025/1/15\n **/\n@PostMapping(\"/suno-cover-callback\")\n@Operation(summary = \"Suno Cover generation callback\", description = \"Receive Cover generation completion notification\")\npublic ResponseEntity<Map<String, String>> handleCoverCallback(\n    @RequestBody CoverCallbackRequest request) {\n    \n    log.info(\"Received cover generation callback: taskId={}, status={}, message={}\", \n        request.getData().getTaskId(), request.getCode(), request.getMsg());\n    \n    try {\n        if (request.getCode() == 200) {\n            // Task completed successfully\n            log.info(\"Cover generation completed\");\n            List<String> images = request.getData().getImages();\n            \n            if (images != null && !images.isEmpty()) {\n                log.info(\"Generated cover images: {}\", images);\n                \n                // Process cover images\n                processCoverImages(request.getData().getTaskId(), images);\n            }\n            \n        } else {\n            // Task failed\n            log.error(\"Cover generation failed: {}\", request.getMsg());\n            \n            // Handle failure cases\n            handleCoverGenerationFailure(request.getData().getTaskId(), \n                request.getCode(), request.getMsg());\n        }\n        \n        // Update task status\n        coverTaskService.updateTaskStatus(request.getData().getTaskId(), \n            request.getCode(), request.getMsg(), request.getData().getImages());\n            \n    } catch (Exception e) {\n        log.error(\"Failed to process cover generation callback\", e);\n        return ResponseEntity.status(500)\n            .body(Map.of(\"status\", \"error\", \"message\", e.getMessage()));\n    }\n    \n    // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return ResponseEntity.ok(Map.of(\"status\", \"received\"));\n}\n\n/**\n * @param taskId Task ID\n * @param imageUrls Image URL list\n * @author zj\n * @description Process cover images\n * @date 2025/1/15\n **/\nprivate void processCoverImages(String taskId, List<String> imageUrls) {\n    // Asynchronously download images\n    CompletableFuture.runAsync(() -> {\n        try {\n            downloadCoverImages(taskId, imageUrls);\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Failed to download cover images: taskId={}\", taskId, e);\n        }\n    });\n}\n\n/**\n * @param taskId Task ID\n * @param imageUrls Image URL list\n * @author zj\n * @description Download cover images\n * @date 2025/1/15\n **/\nprivate void downloadCoverImages(String taskId, List<String> imageUrls) {\n    String dirPath = \"covers/\" + taskId;\n    File dir = new File(dirPath);\n    if (!dir.exists()) {\n        dir.mkdirs();\n    }\n    \n    for (int i = 0; i < imageUrls.size(); i++) {\n        String url = imageUrls.get(i);\n        String filename = dirPath + \"/cover_\" + (i + 1) + \".png\";\n        \n        try {\n            downloadFile(url, filename);\n            log.info(\"Cover saved: {}\", filename);\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            log.error(\"Download failed: {}\", url, e);\n        }\n    }\n}\n\n@Data\npublic class CoverCallbackRequest {\n    private Integer code;\n    private String msg;\n    private CoverCallbackData data;\n}\n\n@Data\npublic class CoverCallbackData {\n    private String taskId;\n    private List<String> images;\n}\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['taskId'] ?? '';\n$images = $callbackData['images'] ?? null;\n\nerror_log(\"Received cover generation callback: $taskId, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Cover generation completed\");\n    \n    if ($images && is_array($images) && count($images) > 0) {\n        error_log(\"Generated cover images: \" . implode(', ', $images));\n        \n        // Download cover images\n        downloadCoverImages($taskId, $images);\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Cover generation failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n}\n\n/**\n * Download cover images\n * @param string $taskId Task ID\n * @param array $imageUrls Image URL array\n */\nfunction downloadCoverImages($taskId, $imageUrls) {\n    // Create directory\n    $dir = \"covers/$taskId\";\n    if (!is_dir($dir)) {\n        mkdir($dir, 0777, true);\n    }\n    \n    foreach ($imageUrls as $index => $url) {\n        $filename = $dir . \"/cover_\" . ($index + 1) . \".png\";\n        \n        try {\n            $imageContent = file_get_contents($url);\n            if ($imageContent !== false) {\n                file_put_contents($filename, $imageContent);\n                error_log(\"Cover saved: $filename\");\n            } else {\n                error_log(\"Download failed: $url\");\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"Download failed $url: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you donâ€™t receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solutions\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the Get Cover Details endpoint to periodically query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-cover-suno-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/separate-vocals-from-music-callbacks\n\n# Audio Separation Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Vocal Separation API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Vocal separation task completed successfully\n*   Vocal separation task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send different format callback data based on the separation type you selected:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Vocal separation completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, unsupported audio file format, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download source audio file\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info\n\nobject\n\nVocal separation result information, returned on success\n\n## separate\\_vocal Type Field Description\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.origin\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal mixed audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.instrumental\\_url\n\nstring\n\nInstrumental-only audio file URL (vocals removed)\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.vocal\\_url\n\nstring\n\nVocals-only audio file URL (instrumental removed)\n\n## split\\_stem Type Field Description\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.origin\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal mixed audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.vocal\\_url\n\nstring\n\nVocals-only audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.backing\\_vocals\\_url\n\nstring\n\nBacking vocals audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.drums\\_url\n\nstring\n\nDrums audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.bass\\_url\n\nstring\n\nBass audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.guitar\\_url\n\nstring\n\nGuitar audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.keyboard\\_url\n\nstring\n\nKeyboard audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.percussion\\_url\n\nstring\n\nPercussion audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.strings\\_url\n\nstring\n\nStrings audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.synth\\_url\n\nstring\n\nSynthesizer audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.fx\\_url\n\nstring\n\nEffects audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.brass\\_url\n\nstring\n\nBrass audio file URL\n\ndata.vocal\\_removal\\_info.woodwinds\\_url\n\nstring\n\nWoodwinds audio file URL\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/vocal-separation-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received vocal separation callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Vocal separation completed');\n    const vocalInfo = data.vocal_removal_info;\n    \n    if (vocalInfo) {\n      console.log('Separation results:');\n      console.log(`  Original audio: ${vocalInfo.origin_url}`);\n      \n      // Handle different separation types\n      if (vocalInfo.instrumental_url) {\n        // separate_vocal type\n        console.log(`  Instrumental only: ${vocalInfo.instrumental_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Vocals only: ${vocalInfo.vocal_url}`);\n      } else {\n        // split_stem type\n        console.log(`  Vocals: ${vocalInfo.vocal_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Backing vocals: ${vocalInfo.backing_vocals_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Drums: ${vocalInfo.drums_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Bass: ${vocalInfo.bass_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Guitar: ${vocalInfo.guitar_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Keyboard: ${vocalInfo.keyboard_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Percussion: ${vocalInfo.percussion_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Strings: ${vocalInfo.strings_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Synthesizer: ${vocalInfo.synth_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Effects: ${vocalInfo.fx_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Brass: ${vocalInfo.brass_url}`);\n        console.log(`  Woodwinds: ${vocalInfo.woodwinds_url}`);\n      }\n      \n      // Download separated audio files\n      const https = require('https');\n      const fs = require('fs');\n      \n      const downloadFile = (url, filename) => {\n        if (!url) return;\n        \n        const file = fs.createWriteStream(filename);\n        https.get(url, (response) => {\n          response.pipe(file);\n          file.on('finish', () => {\n            file.close();\n            console.log(`Saved: ${filename}`);\n          });\n        }).on('error', (err) => {\n          console.error(`Download failed ${filename}:`, err.message);\n        });\n      };\n      \n      // Download all available audio files\n      Object.keys(vocalInfo).forEach(key => {\n        if (vocalInfo[key] && key.endsWith('_url')) {\n          const filename = `${data.task_id}_${key.replace('_url', '')}.mp3`;\n          downloadFile(vocalInfo[key], filename);\n        }\n      });\n    }\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Vocal separation failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or unsupported audio format');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('Source audio file download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/vocal-separation-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    vocal_info = callback_data.get('vocal_removal_info')\n    \n    print(f\"Received vocal separation callback: {task_id}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Vocal separation completed\")\n        \n        if vocal_info:\n            print(\"Separation results:\")\n            print(f\"  Original audio: {vocal_info.get('origin_url')}\")\n            \n            # Handle different separation types\n            if vocal_info.get('instrumental_url'):\n                # separate_vocal type\n                print(f\"  Instrumental only: {vocal_info.get('instrumental_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Vocals only: {vocal_info.get('vocal_url')}\")\n            else:\n                # split_stem type\n                print(f\"  Vocals: {vocal_info.get('vocal_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Backing vocals: {vocal_info.get('backing_vocals_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Drums: {vocal_info.get('drums_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Bass: {vocal_info.get('bass_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Guitar: {vocal_info.get('guitar_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Keyboard: {vocal_info.get('keyboard_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Percussion: {vocal_info.get('percussion_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Strings: {vocal_info.get('strings_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Synthesizer: {vocal_info.get('synth_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Effects: {vocal_info.get('fx_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Brass: {vocal_info.get('brass_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  Woodwinds: {vocal_info.get('woodwinds_url')}\")\n            \n            # Download separated audio files\n            def download_file(url, filename):\n                if not url:\n                    return\n                    \n                try:\n                    response = requests.get(url)\n                    if response.status_code == 200:\n                        with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                            f.write(response.content)\n                        print(f\"Saved: {filename}\")\n                except Exception as e:\n                    print(f\"Download failed {filename}: {e}\")\n            \n            # Download all available audio files\n            for key, url in vocal_info.items():\n                if url and key.endswith('_url'):\n                    filename = f\"{task_id}_{key.replace('_url', '')}.mp3\"\n                    download_file(url, filename)\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Vocal separation failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or unsupported audio format\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"Source audio file download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$vocalInfo = $callbackData['vocal_removal_info'] ?? null;\n\nerror_log(\"Received vocal separation callback: $taskId, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Vocal separation completed\");\n    \n    if ($vocalInfo) {\n        error_log(\"Separation results:\");\n        error_log(\"  Original audio: \" . ($vocalInfo['origin_url'] ?? ''));\n        \n        // Handle different separation types\n        if (isset($vocalInfo['instrumental_url'])) {\n            // separate_vocal type\n            error_log(\"  Instrumental only: \" . ($vocalInfo['instrumental_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Vocals only: \" . ($vocalInfo['vocal_url'] ?? ''));\n        } else {\n            // split_stem type\n            error_log(\"  Vocals: \" . ($vocalInfo['vocal_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Backing vocals: \" . ($vocalInfo['backing_vocals_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Drums: \" . ($vocalInfo['drums_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Bass: \" . ($vocalInfo['bass_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Guitar: \" . ($vocalInfo['guitar_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Keyboard: \" . ($vocalInfo['keyboard_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Percussion: \" . ($vocalInfo['percussion_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Strings: \" . ($vocalInfo['strings_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Synthesizer: \" . ($vocalInfo['synth_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Effects: \" . ($vocalInfo['fx_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Brass: \" . ($vocalInfo['brass_url'] ?? ''));\n            error_log(\"  Woodwinds: \" . ($vocalInfo['woodwinds_url'] ?? ''));\n        }\n        \n        // Download separated audio files\n        function downloadFile($url, $filename) {\n            if (!$url) return;\n            \n            try {\n                $content = file_get_contents($url);\n                if ($content !== false) {\n                    file_put_contents($filename, $content);\n                    error_log(\"Saved: $filename\");\n                }\n            } catch (Exception $e) {\n                error_log(\"Download failed $filename: \" . $e->getMessage());\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Download all available audio files\n        foreach ($vocalInfo as $key => $url) {\n            if ($url && strpos($key, '_url') !== false) {\n                $filename = $taskId . '_' . str_replace('_url', '', $key) . '.mp3';\n                downloadFile($url, $filename);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Vocal separation failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or unsupported audio format\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"Source audio file download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get vocal separation details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-vocal-separation-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/upload-and-cover-audio\n\n#  \n    \n    ](/suno-api/cover-suno)\n*   [\n    \n    Music Cover Generation Callbacks\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/cover-suno-callbacks)\n*   [POST\n    \n    Replace Music Section\n    \n   \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-cover-suno-details)\n*   [POST\n    \n    Generate Persona\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/generate-persona)\n\n*   [POST\n    \n    Generate Lyrics\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/generate-lyrics)\n*   [\n    \n    Lyrics Generation Callbacks\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/generate-lyrics-callbacks)\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get Lyrics Generation Details\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-lyrics-generation-details)\n\n*   [POST\n    \n    Convert to WAV Format\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/convert-to-wav-format)\n*   [\n    \n    WAV Format Conversion Callbacks\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/convert-to-wav-format-callbacks)\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get WAV Conversion Details\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-wav-conversion-details)\n\n*   [POST\n    \n    Vocalâ€¯&â€¯Instrument Stem Separation\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/separate-vocals-from-music)\n*   [\n    \n    Audio Separation Callbacks\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/separate-vocals-from-music-callbacks)\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get Audio Separation Details\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-vocal-separation-details)\n\n*   [POST\n    \n    Create Music Video\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/create-music-video)\n*   [\n    \n    Music Video Generation Callbacks\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/create-music-video-callbacks)\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get Music Video Details\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-music-video-details)\n\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get Remaining Credits\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-remaining-credits)\n\nUpload And Cover Audio\n\ncURL\n\n```\ncurl --request POST \\\n  --url https://api.sunoapi.org/api/v1/generate/upload-cover \\\n  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \\\n  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n  --data '\n{\n  \"uploadUrl\": \"https://storage.example.com/upload\",\n  \"customMode\": true,\n  \"instrumental\": true,\n  \"model\": \"V4_5ALL\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"prompt\": \"A calm and relaxing piano track with soft melodies\",\n  \"style\": \"Classical\",\n  \"title\": \"Peaceful Piano Meditation\",\n  \"personaId\": \"persona_123\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Heavy Metal, Upbeat Drums\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.65,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65\n}\n'\n```\n\n200\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"5c79****be8e\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\nPOST\n\n/\n\napi\n\n/\n\nv1\n\n/\n\ngenerate\n\n/\n\nupload-cover\n\nTry it\n\nUpload And Cover Audio\n\ncURL\n\n```\ncurl --request POST \\\n  --url https://api.sunoapi.org/api/v1/generate/upload-cover \\\n  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \\\n  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n  --data '\n{\n  \"uploadUrl\": \"https://storage.example.com/upload\",\n  \"customMode\": true,\n  \"instrumental\": true,\n  \"model\": \"V4_5ALL\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"prompt\": \"A calm and relaxing piano track with soft melodies\",\n  \"style\": \"Classical\",\n  \"title\": \"Peaceful Piano Meditation\",\n  \"personaId\": \"persona_123\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Heavy Metal, Upbeat Drums\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.65,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65\n}\n'\n```\n\n200\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"5c79****be8e\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#parameter-usage-guide)\n\nParameter Usage Guide\n\n*   When customMode is true (Custom Mode):\n    *   If instrumental is true: style, title and uploadUrl are required\n    *   If instrumental is false: style, prompt, title and uploadUrl are required\n    *   prompt length limit by model:\n        *   **V4**: Maximum 3000 characters\n        *   **V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5**: Maximum 5000 characters\n    *   style length limit by model:\n        *   **V4**: Maximum 200 characters\n        *   **V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5**: Maximum 1000 characters\n    *   title length limit by model:\n        *   **V4 & V4\\_5ALL**: Maximum 80 characters\n        *   **V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS & V5**: Maximum 100 characters\n    *   uploadUrl is used to specify the upload location of the audio file; ensure the uploaded audio does not exceed 8 minutes in length.\n        *   **Important**: When using the **V4\\_5ALL** model, the uploaded audio file must not exceed **1 minute** in length.\n*   When customMode is false (Non-custom Mode):\n    *   Only prompt and uploadUrl are required regardless of instrumental setting\n    *   prompt length limit: 500 characters\n    *   Other parameters should be left empty\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#developer-notes)\n\nDeveloper Notes\n\n1.  Recommended settings for new users: Set customMode to false, instrumental to false, and only provide prompt and uploadUrl. This is the simplest configuration to quickly test the API and experience the results.\n2.  **V4\\_5ALL Model Upload Limit**: When using the V4\\_5ALL model, the uploaded audio file must not exceed **1 minute** in length.\n3.  Generated files will be deleted after 15 days\n4.  Ensure all required parameters are provided based on customMode and instrumental settings to avoid errors\n5.  Pay attention to character limits for prompt, style, and title to ensure successful processing\n6.  Callback process has three stages: text (text generation complete), first (first track complete), complete (all tracks complete)\n7.  You can use the Get Music Generation Details endpoint to actively check task status instead of waiting for callbacks\n8.  The uploadUrl parameter is used to specify the upload location of the audio file; please provide a valid URL.\n\n#### Authorizations\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#authorization-authorization)\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n# ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\nThe URL for uploading audio files, required regardless of whether customMode and instrumental are true or false. Ensure the uploaded audio does not exceed 8 minutes in length. Note: When using the V4\\_5ALL model, the uploaded audio file must not exceed 1 minute in length.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://storage.example.com/upload\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-custom-mode)\n\ncustomMode\n\nboolean\n\nrequired\n\nEnables Custom Mode for advanced audio generation settings.\n\n*   Set to `true` to use Custom Mode (requires `style` and `title`; `prompt` required if `instrumental` is `false`). The prompt will be strictly used as lyrics if `instrumental` is `false`.\n*   Set to `false` for Non-custom Mode (only `prompt` is required). Lyrics will be auto-generated based on the prompt.\n\nExample:\n\n`true`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-instrumental)\n\ninstrumental\n\nboolean\n\nrequired\n\nDetermines if the audio should be instrumental (no lyrics).\n\n*   In Custom Mode (`customMode: true`):\n    *   If `true`: Only `style` and `title` are required.\n    *   If `false`: `style`, `title`, and `prompt` are required (with `prompt` used as the exact lyrics).\n*   In Non-custom Mode (`customMode: false`): No impact on required fields (`prompt` only). Lyrics are auto-generated if `instrumental` is `false`.\n\nExample:\n\n`true`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-model)\n\nmodel\n\nenum<string>\n\nrequired\n\nThe model version to use for audio generation.\n\n*   Choose between: `V4`, `V4_5`, `V4_5PLUS`, `V4_5ALL`, or `V5`. Note: Ensure correct formatting (e.g., use \"V4\" or \"V4\\_5ALL\", not \"V4.5\" or other variations).\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`V4`,\n\n`V4_5`,\n\n`V4_5PLUS`,\n\n`V4_5ALL`,\n\n`V5`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"V4_5ALL\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-call-back-url)\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive task completion notifications when audio covering is complete.\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Upload and Cover Audio Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/upload-and-cover-audio-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the get music generation details endpoint to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-prompt)\n\nprompt\n\nstring\n\nA description of the desired audio content.\n\n*   In Custom Mode (`customMode: true`): Required if `instrumental` is `false`. The prompt will be strictly used as the lyrics and sung in the generated track. Character limits by model:\n    *   V4: Maximum 3000 characters\n    *   V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5: Maximum 5000 characters  \n        Example: \"A calm and relaxing piano track with soft melodies\"\n*   In Non-custom Mode (`customMode: false`): Always required. The prompt serves as the core idea, and lyrics will be automatically generated based on it (not strictly matching the input). Maximum 500 characters.  \n    Example: \"A short relaxing piano tune\"\n\nExample:\n\n`\"A calm and relaxing piano track with soft melodies\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style)\n\nstyle\n\nstring\n\nThe music style or genre for the audio.\n\n*   Required in Custom Mode (`customMode: true`). Examples: \"Jazz\", \"Classical\", \"Electronic\". Character limits by model:\n    *   V4: Maximum 200 characters\n    *   V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5: Maximum 1000 characters  \n        Example: \"Classical\"\n*   In Non-custom Mode (`customMode: false`): Leave empty.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Classical\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-title)\n\ntitle\n\nstring\n\nThe title of the generated music track.\n\n*   Required in Custom Mode (`customMode: true`). Character limits by model:\n    *   V4 & V4\\_5ALL: Maximum 80 characters\n    *   V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS & V5: Maximum 100 characters  \n        Example: \"Peaceful Piano Meditation\"\n*   In Non-custom Mode (`customMode: false`): Leave empty.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Peaceful Piano Meditation\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-persona-id)\n\npersonaId\n\nstring\n\nOnly available when Custom Mode (`customMode: true`) is enabled. Persona ID to apply to the generated music. Optional. Use this to apply a specific persona style to your music generation.\n\nTo generate a persona ID, use the [Generate Persona](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-persona) endpoint to create a personalized music Persona based on generated music.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"persona_123\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-negative-tags)\n\nnegativeTags\n\nstring\n\nMusic styles or traits to exclude from the generated audio.\n\n*   Optional. Use to avoid specific styles.  \n    Example: \"Heavy Metal, Upbeat Drums\"\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Heavy Metal, Upbeat Drums\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-vocal-gender)\n\nvocalGender\n\nenum<string>\n\nPreferred vocal gender for generated vocals. Optional.\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`m`,\n\n`f`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"m\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style-weight)\n\nstyleWeight\n\nnumber\n\nWeight of the provided style guidance. Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-weirdness-constraint)\n\nweirdnessConstraint\n\nnumber\n\nConstraint on creative deviation/novelty. Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-audio-weight)\n\naudioWeight\n\nnumber\n\nWeight of the input audio influence (where applicable). Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n#### Response\n\n200\n\napplication/json\n\nRequest successful\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-code)\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n# Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nExample:\n\n`200`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-msg)\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-data)\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Music Extension Callbacks](/suno-api/extend-music-callbacks)[Upload and Cover Audio Callbacks](/suno-api/upload-and-cover-audio-callbacks)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/extend-music\n\n# Extend Music - Suno API\n\n[![light
