 [\n    \n    Audio Separation Callbacks\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/separate-vocals-from-music-callbacks)\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get Audio Separation Details\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-vocal-separation-details)\n\n*   [POST\n    \n    Create Music Video\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/create-music-video)\n*   [\n    \n    Music Video Generation Callbacks\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/create-music-video-callbacks)\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get Music Video Details\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-music-video-details)\n\n*   [GET\n    \n    Get Remaining Credits\n    \n    \n    \n    ](/suno-api/get-remaining-credits)\n\nExtend Music\n\ncURL\n\n```\ncurl --request POST \\\n  --url https://api.sunoapi.org/api/v1/generate/extend \\\n  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \\\n  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n  --data '\n{\n  \"defaultParamFlag\": true,\n  \"audioId\": \"e231****-****-****-****-****8cadc7dc\",\n  \"model\": \"V4_5ALL\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"prompt\": \"Extend the music with more relaxing notes\",\n  \"style\": \"Classical\",\n  \"title\": \"Peaceful Piano Extended\",\n  \"continueAt\": 60,\n  \"personaId\": \"persona_123\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Relaxing Piano\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.65,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65\n}\n'\n```\n\n200\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"5c79****be8e\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\nPOST\n\n/\n\napi\n\n/\n\nv1\n\n/\n\ngenerate\n\n/\n\nextend\n\nTry it\n\nExtend Music\n\ncURL\n\n```\ncurl --request POST \\\n  --url https://api.sunoapi.org/api/v1/generate/extend \\\n  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \\\n  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n  --data '\n{\n  \"defaultParamFlag\": true,\n  \"audioId\": \"e231****-****-****-****-****8cadc7dc\",\n  \"model\": \"V4_5ALL\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"prompt\": \"Extend the music with more relaxing notes\",\n  \"style\": \"Classical\",\n  \"title\": \"Peaceful Piano Extended\",\n  \"continueAt\": 60,\n  \"personaId\": \"persona_123\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Relaxing Piano\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.65,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65\n}\n'\n```\n\n200\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"5c79****be8e\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#parameter-usage-guide)\n\nParameter Usage Guide\n\n*   When defaultParamFlag is true (Custom Parameters):\n    *   prompt, style, title and continueAt are required\n    *   Prompt length limit:\n        *   For V4 model: 3000 characters\n        *   For V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL and V5 models: 5000 characters\n    *   Style length limit:\n        *   For V4 model: 200 characters\n        *   For V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL and V5 models: 1000 characters\n    *   Title length limit:\n        *   For V4 and V4\\_5ALL model: 80 characters\n        *   For V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS and V5 models: 100 characters\n*   When defaultParamFlag is false (Use Default Parameters):\n    *   Only audioId is required\n    *   Other parameters will use the original audioâ€™s parameters\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#developer-notes)\n\nDeveloper Notes\n\n1.  Generated files are retained for 15 days\n2.  Model version must be consistent with the source music\n3.  This feature is ideal for creating longer compositions by extending existing tracks\n\n#### Authorizations\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#authorization-authorization)\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n# ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-default-param-flag)\n\ndefaultParamFlag\n\nboolean\n\nrequired\n\nControls parameter usage mode.\n\n*   `true`: Use custom parameters (requires `continueAt`, `prompt`, `style`, and `title`).\n*   `false`: Use original audio parameters (only `audioId` is required).\n\nExample:\n\n`true`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-audio-id)\n\naudioId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nAudio ID of the track to extend. This is the source track that will be continued.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"e231****-****-****-****-****8cadc7dc\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-model)\n\nmodel\n\nenum<string>\n\nrequired\n\nModel version to use, must be consistent with the source audio.\n\n*   Available options:\n    *   `V5`: Superior musical expression, faster generation.\n    *   `V4_5PLUS`: V4.5+ is richer sound, new waysto create, max 8 min.\n    *   `V4_5ALL`: V4.5-all is better song structure, max 8 min.\n    *   `V4_5`: V4.5 is smarter prompts, fastergenerations, max 8 min.\n    *   `V4`: V4 is improved vocal quality,max 4 min.\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`V4`,\n\n`V4_5`,\n\n`V4_5PLUS`,\n\n`V4_5ALL`,\n\n`V5`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"V4_5ALL\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-call-back-url)\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive task completion notifications when music extension is complete.\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Music Extension Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/extend-music-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the get music generation details endpoint to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-prompt)\n\nprompt\n\nstring\n\nDescription of how the music should be extended. Required when defaultParamFlag is true.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Extend the music with more relaxing notes\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style)\n\nstyle\n\nstring\n\nMusic style, e.g., Jazz, Classical, Electronic\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Classical\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-title)\n\ntitle\n\nstring\n\nMusic title\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Peaceful Piano Extended\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-continue-at)\n\ncontinueAt\n\nnumber\n\nThe time point (in seconds) from which to start extending the music.\n\n*   Required when `defaultParamFlag` is `true`.\n*   Value range: greater than 0 and less than the total duration of the generated audio.\n*   Specifies the position in the original track where the extension should begin.\n\nExample:\n\n`60`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-persona-id)\n\npersonaId\n\nstring\n\nOnly available when Custom Mode (`customMode: true`) is enabled. Persona ID to apply to the generated music. Optional. Use this to apply a specific persona style to your music generation.\n\nTo generate a persona ID, use the [Generate Persona](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-persona) endpoint to create a personalized music Persona based on generated music.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"persona_123\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-negative-tags)\n\nnegativeTags\n\nstring\n\nMusic styles to exclude from generation\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Relaxing Piano\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-vocal-gender)\n\nvocalGender\n\nenum<string>\n\nPreferred vocal gender for generated vocals. Optional.\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`m`,\n\n`f`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"m\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style-weight)\n\nstyleWeight\n\nnumber\n\nWeight of the provided style guidance. Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-weirdness-constraint)\n\nweirdnessConstraint\n\nnumber\n\nConstraint on creative deviation/novelty. Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-audio-weight)\n\naudioWeight\n\nnumber\n\nWeight of the input audio influence (where applicable). Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n#### Response\n\n200\n\napplication/json\n\nRequest successful\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-code)\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n# Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nExample:\n\n`200`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-msg)\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-data)\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Music Generation Callbacks](/suno-api/generate-music-callbacks)[Music Extension Callbacks](/suno-api/extend-music-callbacks)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/create-music-video-callbacks\n\n# Music Video Generation Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Music Video Generation API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Music video generation task completed successfully\n*   Music video generation task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Music video generation completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, unsupported audio file format, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download source audio file\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.video\\_url\n\nstring\n\nGenerated MP4 video file download URL, returned on success\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/music-video-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received music video generation callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Music video generation completed');\n    console.log(`Video URL: ${data.video_url}`);\n    \n    // Download video file\n    if (data.video_url) {\n      const https = require('https');\n      const fs = require('fs');\n      \n      const filename = `music_video_${data.task_id}.mp4`;\n      const file = fs.createWriteStream(filename);\n      \n      https.get(data.video_url, (response) => {\n        response.pipe(file);\n        file.on('finish', () => {\n          file.close();\n          console.log(`Video file saved as ${filename}`);\n        });\n      }).on('error', (err) => {\n        console.error('Video file download failed:', err.message);\n      });\n    }\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Music video generation failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or unsupported audio file format');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('Source audio file download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/music-video-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    video_url = callback_data.get('video_url')\n    \n    print(f\"Received music video generation callback: {task_id}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Music video generation completed\")\n        print(f\"Video URL: {video_url}\")\n        \n        # Download video file example\n        if video_url:\n            try:\n                response = requests.get(video_url)\n                if response.status_code == 200:\n                    filename = f\"music_video_{task_id}.mp4\"\n                    with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                        f.write(response.content)\n                    print(f\"Video file saved as {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"Video file download failed: {e}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Music video generation failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or unsupported audio file format\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"Source audio file download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$videoUrl = $callbackData['video_url'] ?? '';\n\nerror_log(\"Received music video generation callback: $taskId, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Music video generation completed\");\n    error_log(\"Video URL: $videoUrl\");\n    \n    // Download video file example\n    if ($videoUrl) {\n        try {\n            $videoContent = file_get_contents($videoUrl);\n            if ($videoContent !== false) {\n                $filename = \"music_video_{$taskId}.mp4\";\n                file_put_contents($filename, $videoContent);\n                error_log(\"Video file saved as $filename\");\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"Video file download failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Music video generation failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or unsupported audio file format\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"Source audio file download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get music video details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-music-video-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/upload-and-cover-audio-callbacks\n\n# Upload and Cover Audio Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Upload and Cover Audio API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Audio covering task completed successfully\n*   Audio covering task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Audio covering completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, unsupported audio file format, content violation, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download source audio file\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.callbackType\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nCallback type indicating the current callback stage:\n\n*   `text`: Text generation completed\n*   `first`: First music track completed\n*   `complete`: All music tracks completed\n*   `error`: Task failed\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.data\n\narray\n\nAudio covering result information, returned on success\n\ndata.data\\[\\].id\n\nstring\n\nMusic unique identifier\n\ndata.data\\[\\].audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nCovered audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nStreaming audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal streaming audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nCover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal cover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].prompt\n\nstring\n\nGeneration prompt/lyrics\n\ndata.data\\[\\].model\\_name\n\nstring\n\nModel name used\n\ndata.data\\[\\].title\n\nstring\n\nMusic title\n\ndata.data\\[\\].tags\n\nstring\n\nMusic tags\n\ndata.data\\[\\].createTime\n\nstring\n\nCreation time\n\ndata.data\\[\\].duration\n\nnumber\n\nAudio duration (seconds)\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/upload-cover-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received audio covering callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    callbackType: data.callbackType,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Audio covering completed');\n    const musicData = data.data || [];\n    \n    console.log(`Covered ${musicData.length} music tracks:`);\n    musicData.forEach((music, index) => {\n      console.log(`Covered music ${index + 1}:`);\n      console.log(`  Title: ${music.title}`);\n      console.log(`  Duration: ${music.duration} seconds`);\n      console.log(`  Style tags: ${music.tags}`);\n      console.log(`  Covered audio URL: ${music.audio_url}`);\n      console.log(`  Cover URL: ${music.image_url}`);\n    });\n    \n    // Process covered music\n    // Can download audio files, save locally, etc.\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Audio covering failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or content violation');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('Source audio file download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/upload-cover-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    callback_type = callback_data.get('callbackType')\n    music_data = callback_data.get('data', [])\n    \n    print(f\"Received audio covering callback: {task_id}, type: {callback_type}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Audio covering completed\")\n        \n        print(f\"Covered {len(music_data)} music tracks:\")\n        for i, music in enumerate(music_data):\n            print(f\"Covered music {i + 1}:\")\n            print(f\"  Title: {music.get('title')}\")\n            print(f\"  Duration: {music.get('duration')} seconds\")\n            print(f\"  Style tags: {music.get('tags')}\")\n            print(f\"  Covered audio URL: {music.get('audio_url')}\")\n            print(f\"  Cover URL: {music.get('image_url')}\")\n            \n            # Download covered audio file example\n            try:\n                audio_url = music.get('audio_url')\n                if audio_url:\n                    response = requests.get(audio_url)\n                    if response.status_code == 200:\n                        filename = f\"covered_music_{task_id}_{i + 1}.mp3\"\n                        with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                            f.write(response.content)\n                        print(f\"Covered audio saved as {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"Audio download failed: {e}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Audio covering failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or content violation\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"Source audio file download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$callbackType = $callbackData['callbackType'] ?? '';\n$musicData = $callbackData['data'] ?? [];\n\nerror_log(\"Received audio covering callback: $taskId, type: $callbackType, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Audio covering completed\");\n    \n    error_log(\"Covered \" . count($musicData) . \" music tracks:\");\n    foreach ($musicData as $index => $music) {\n        error_log(\"Covered music \" . ($index + 1) . \":\");\n        error_log(\"  Title: \" . ($music['title'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Duration: \" . ($music['duration'] ?? 0) . \" seconds\");\n        error_log(\"  Style tags: \" . ($music['tags'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Covered audio URL: \" . ($music['audio_url'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Cover URL: \" . ($music['image_url'] ?? ''));\n        \n        // Download covered audio file example\n        try {\n            $audioUrl = $music['audio_url'] ?? '';\n            if ($audioUrl) {\n                $audioContent = file_get_contents($audioUrl);\n                if ($audioContent !== false) {\n                    $filename = \"covered_music_{$taskId}_\" . ($index + 1) . \".mp3\";\n                    file_put_contents($filename, $audioContent);\n                    error_log(\"Covered audio saved as $filename\");\n                }\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"Audio download failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Audio covering failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or content violation\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"Source audio file download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get music generation details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-music-generation-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/extend-music-callbacks\n\n# Music Extension Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Music Extension API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Music extension task completed successfully\n*   Music extension task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Music extension completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, content violation, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download related files\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.callbackType\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nCallback type indicating the current callback stage:\n\n*   `text`: Text generation completed\n*   `first`: First music track completed\n*   `complete`: All music tracks completed\n*   `error`: Task failed\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.data\n\narray\n\nMusic extension result information, returned on success\n\ndata.data\\[\\].id\n\nstring\n\nMusic unique identifier\n\ndata.data\\[\\].audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nExtended audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nStreaming audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal streaming audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nCover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal cover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].prompt\n\nstring\n\nGeneration prompt/lyrics\n\ndata.data\\[\\].model\\_name\n\nstring\n\nModel name used\n\ndata.data\\[\\].title\n\nstring\n\nMusic title\n\ndata.data\\[\\].tags\n\nstring\n\nMusic tags\n\ndata.data\\[\\].createTime\n\nstring\n\nCreation time\n\ndata.data\\[\\].duration\n\nnumber\n\nAudio duration (seconds)\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/extend-music-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received music extension callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    callbackType: data.callbackType,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Music extension completed');\n    const musicData = data.data || [];\n    \n    console.log(`Extended ${musicData.length} music tracks:`);\n    musicData.forEach((music, index) => {\n      console.log(`Music ${index + 1}:`);\n      console.log(`  Title: ${music.title}`);\n      console.log(`  Duration: ${music.duration} seconds`);\n      console.log(`  Audio URL: ${music.audio_url}`);\n      console.log(`  Cover URL: ${music.image_url}`);\n    });\n    \n    // Process extended music\n    // Can download audio files, save locally, etc.\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Music extension failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or content violation');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('File download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/extend-music-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    callback_type = callback_data.get('callbackType')\n    music_data = callback_data.get('data', [])\n    \n    print(f\"Received music extension callback: {task_id}, type: {callback_type}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Music extension completed\")\n        \n        print(f\"Extended {len(music_data)} music tracks:\")\n        for i, music in enumerate(music_data):\n            print(f\"Music {i + 1}:\")\n            print(f\"  Title: {music.get('title')}\")\n            print(f\"  Duration: {music.get('duration')} seconds\")\n            print(f\"  Audio URL: {music.get('audio_url')}\")\n            print(f\"  Cover URL: {music.get('image_url')}\")\n            \n            # Download audio file example\n            try:\n                audio_url = music.get('audio_url')\n                if audio_url:\n                    response = requests.get(audio_url)\n                    if response.status_code == 200:\n                        filename = f\"extended_music_{task_id}_{i + 1}.mp3\"\n                        with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                            f.write(response.content)\n                        print(f\"Audio saved as {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"Audio download failed: {e}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Music extension failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or content violation\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"File download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$callbackType = $callbackData['callbackType'] ?? '';\n$musicData = $callbackData['data'] ?? [];\n\nerror_log(\"Received music extension callback: $taskId, type: $callbackType, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Music extension completed\");\n    \n    error_log(\"Extended \" . count($musicData) . \" music tracks:\");\n    foreach ($musicData as $index => $music) {\n        error_log(\"Music \" . ($index + 1) . \":\");\n        error_log(\"  Title: \" . ($music['title'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Duration: \" . ($music['duration'] ?? 0) . \" seconds\");\n        error_log(\"  Audio URL: \" . ($music['audio_url'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Cover URL: \" . ($music['image_url'] ?? ''));\n        \n        // Download audio file example\n        try {\n            $audioUrl = $music['audio_url'] ?? '';\n            if ($audioUrl) {\n                $audioContent = file_get_contents($audioUrl);\n                if ($audioContent !== false) {\n                    $filename = \"extended_music_{$taskId}_\" . ($index + 1) . \".mp3\";\n                    file_put_contents($filename, $audioContent);\n                    error_log(\"Audio saved as $filename\");\n                }\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"Audio download failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Music extension failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or content violation\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"File download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get music generation details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-music-generation-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/upload-and-extend-audio\n\n# --header 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \\\n  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n  --data '\n{\n  \"uploadUrl\": \"https://storage.example.com/upload\",\n  \"defaultParamFlag\": true,\n  \"model\": \"V4_5ALL\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"instrumental\": true,\n  \"prompt\": \"Extend the music with more relaxing notes\",\n  \"style\": \"Classical\",\n  \"title\": \"Peaceful Piano Extended\",\n  \"continueAt\": 60,\n  \"personaId\": \"persona_123\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Relaxing Piano\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.65,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65\n}\n'\n```\n\n200\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"5c79****be8e\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\nPOST\n\n/\n\napi\n\n/\n\nv1\n\n/\n\ngenerate\n\n/\n\nupload-extend\n\nTry it\n\nUpload And Extend Audio\n\ncURL\n\n```\ncurl --request POST \\\n  --url https://api.sunoapi.org/api/v1/generate/upload-extend \\\n  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \\\n  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \\\n  --data '\n{\n  \"uploadUrl\": \"https://storage.example.com/upload\",\n  \"defaultParamFlag\": true,\n  \"model\": \"V4_5ALL\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"instrumental\": true,\n  \"prompt\": \"Extend the music with more relaxing notes\",\n  \"style\": \"Classical\",\n  \"title\": \"Peaceful Piano Extended\",\n  \"continueAt\": 60,\n  \"personaId\": \"persona_123\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Relaxing Piano\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.65,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65\n}\n'\n```\n\n200\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"5c79****be8e\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#parameter-usage-guide)\n\nParameter Usage Guide\n\n*   When defaultParamFlag is true (Custom Parameters):\n    *   If instrumental is true: style, title, and uploadUrl are required\n    *   If instrumental is false: style, prompt, title, and uploadUrl are required\n    *   prompt length limit by model:\n        *   **V4**: Maximum 3000 characters\n        *   **V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5**: Maximum 5000 characters\n    *   style length limit by model:\n        *   **V4**: Maximum 200 characters\n        *   **V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5**: Maximum 1000 characters\n    *   title length limit by model:\n        *   **V4 & V4\\_5ALL**: Maximum 80 characters\n        *   **V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS & V5**: Maximum 100 characters\n    *   continueAt: the time point in seconds from which to start extending (must be greater than 0 and less than the uploaded audio duration)\n    *   uploadUrl: specifies the upload location for audio files; ensure uploaded audio does not exceed 8 minutes.\n        *   **Important**: When using the **V4\\_5ALL** model, the uploaded audio file must not exceed **1 minute** in length.\n*   When defaultParamFlag is false (Default Parameters):\n    *   Regardless of instrumental setting, only uploadUrl and prompt are required\n    *   Other parameters will use the original audioâ€™s parameters\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#developer-notes)\n\nDeveloper Notes\n\n1.  Generated files will be retained for 14 days\n2.  Model version must be consistent with the source music\n3.  **V4\\_5ALL Model Upload Limit**: When using the V4\\_5ALL model, the uploaded audio file must not exceed **1 minute** in length.\n4.  This feature is ideal for creating longer works by extending existing music\n5.  uploadUrl parameter specifies the upload location for audio files; provide a valid URL.\n\n#### Authorizations\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#authorization-authorization)\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n# ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\nThe URL for uploading audio files, required regardless of whether defaultParamFlag is true or false. Ensure the uploaded audio does not exceed 8 minutes in length. Note: When using the V4\\_5ALL model, the uploaded audio file must not exceed 1 minute in length.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://storage.example.com/upload\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-default-param-flag)\n\ndefaultParamFlag\n\nboolean\n\nrequired\n\nEnable custom mode for advanced audio generation settings.\n\n*   Set to `true` to use custom parameter mode (requires `style`, `title`, and `uploadUrl`; if `instrumental` is `false`, `uploadUrl` and `prompt` are required). If `instrumental` is `false`, the prompt will be strictly used as lyrics.\n*   Set to `false` to use non-custom mode (only `uploadUrl` required). Lyrics will be automatically generated based on the prompt.\n\nExample:\n\n`true`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-model)\n\nmodel\n\nenum<string>\n\nrequired\n\nModel version to use, must be consistent with the source audio\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`V4`,\n\n`V4_5`,\n\n`V4_5PLUS`,\n\n`V4_5ALL`,\n\n`V5`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"V4_5ALL\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-call-back-url)\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive task completion notifications when music extension is complete.\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Upload and Extend Audio Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/upload-and-extend-audio-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the get music generation details endpoint to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-instrumental)\n\ninstrumental\n\nboolean\n\nDetermines whether the audio is instrumental (without lyrics).\n\n*   In custom parameter mode (`defaultParamFlag: true`):\n    *   If `true`: only `style`, `title`, and `uploadUrl` are required.\n    *   If `false`: `style`, `title`, `prompt` (`prompt` will be used as exact lyrics), and `uploadUrl` are required.\n*   In non-custom parameter mode (`defaultParamFlag: false`): does not affect required fields (only `uploadUrl` needed). If `false`, lyrics will be automatically generated.\n\nExample:\n\n`true`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-prompt)\n\nprompt\n\nstring\n\nDescription of how the music should be extended. Required when defaultParamFlag is true. Character limits by model:\n\n*   V4: Maximum 3000 characters\n*   V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5: Maximum 5000 characters\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Extend the music with more relaxing notes\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style)\n\nstyle\n\nstring\n\nMusic style, e.g., Jazz, Classical, Electronic. Character limits by model:\n\n*   V4: Maximum 200 characters\n*   V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS, V4\\_5ALL & V5: Maximum 1000 characters\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Classical\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-title)\n\ntitle\n\nstring\n\nMusic title. Character limits by model:\n\n*   V4 & V4\\_5ALL: Maximum 80 characters\n*   V4\\_5, V4\\_5PLUS & V5: Maximum 100 characters\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Peaceful Piano Extended\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-continue-at)\n\ncontinueAt\n\nnumber\n\nThe time point (in seconds) from which to start extending the music.\n\n*   Required when `defaultParamFlag` is `true`.\n*   Value range: greater than 0 and less than the total duration of the uploaded audio.\n*   Specifies the position in the original track where the extension should begin.\n\nExample:\n\n`60`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-persona-id)\n\npersonaId\n\nstring\n\nOnly available when Custom Mode (`customMode: true`) is enabled. Persona ID to apply to the generated music. Optional. Use this to apply a specific persona style to your music generation.\n\nTo generate a persona ID, use the [Generate Persona](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-persona) endpoint to create a personalized music Persona based on generated music.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"persona_123\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-negative-tags)\n\nnegativeTags\n\nstring\n\nMusic styles to exclude from generation\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Relaxing Piano\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-vocal-gender)\n\nvocalGender\n\nenum<string>\n\nPreferred vocal gender for generated vocals. Optional.\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`m`,\n\n`f`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"m\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style-weight)\n\nstyleWeight\n\nnumber\n\nWeight of the provided style guidance. Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-weirdness-constraint)\n\nweirdnessConstraint\n\nnumber\n\nConstraint on creative deviation/novelty. Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-audio-weight)\n\naudioWeight\n\nnumber\n\nWeight of the input audio influence (where applicable). Range 0.00â€“1.00.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n#### Response\n\n200\n\napplication/json\n\nRequest successful\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-code)\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n# Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nExample:\n\n`200`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-msg)\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-data)\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Upload and Cover Audio Callbacks](/suno-api/upload-and-cover-audio-callbacks)[Upload and Extend Audio Callbacks](/suno-api/upload-and-extend-audio-callbacks)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-lyrics-callbacks\n\n# Lyrics Generation Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Lyrics Generation API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Lyrics generation task completed successfully\n*   Lyrics generation task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Lyrics generation completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, content violation, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download related files\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.callbackType\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nCallback type indicating the current callback stage:\n\n*   `complete`: Lyrics generation completed\n*   `error`: Task failed\n\ndata.taskId\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.data\n\narray\n\nLyrics generation result information, returns multiple lyrics variants on success\n\ndata.data\\[\\].text\n\nstring\n\nGenerated lyrics content, including song structure markers (e.g., \\[Verse\\], \\[Chorus\\], etc.)\n\ndata.data\\[\\].title\n\nstring\n\nLyrics title\n\ndata.data\\[\\].status\n\nstring\n\nLyrics generation status:\n\n*   `complete`: Generation completed\n*   `failed`: Generation failed\n\ndata.data\\[\\].errorMessage\n\nstring\n\nError message, contains specific error description when status is failed\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/generate-lyrics-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received lyrics generation callback:', {\n    taskId: data.taskId,\n    callbackType: data.callbackType,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Lyrics generation completed');\n    const lyricsData = data.data || [];\n    \n    console.log(`Generated ${lyricsData.length} lyrics variants:`);\n    lyricsData.forEach((lyrics, index) => {\n      console.log(`Lyrics variant ${index + 1}:`);\n      console.log(`  Title: ${lyrics.title}`);\n      console.log(`  Status: ${lyrics.status}`);\n      if (lyrics.status === 'complete') {\n        console.log(`  Lyrics content:\\n${lyrics.text}`);\n      } else {\n        console.log(`  Error message: ${lyrics.errorMessage}`);\n      }\n    });\n    \n    // Process generated lyrics\n    // Can save to database, files, etc.\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Lyrics generation failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or content violation');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('File download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/generate-lyrics-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('taskId')\n    callback_type = callback_data.get('callbackType')\n    lyrics_data = callback_data.get('data', [])\n    \n    print(f\"Received lyrics generation callback: {task_id}, type: {callback_type}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Lyrics generation completed\")\n        \n        print(f\"Generated {len(lyrics_data)} lyrics variants:\")\n        for i, lyrics in enumerate(lyrics_data):\n            print(f\"Lyrics variant {i + 1}:\")\n            print(f\"  Title: {lyrics.get('title')}\")\n            print(f\"  Status: {lyrics.get('status')}\")\n            if lyrics.get('status') == 'complete':\n                print(f\"  Lyrics content:\\n{lyrics.get('text')}\")\n                \n                # Save lyrics to file example\n                try:\n                    filename = f\"lyrics_{task_id}_{i + 1}.txt\"\n                    with open(filename, \"w\", encoding=\"utf-8\") as f:\n                        f.write(f\"Title: {lyrics.get('title')}\\n\\n\")\n                        f.write(lyrics.get('text'))\n                    print(f\"Lyrics saved as {filename}\")\n                except Exception as e:\n                    print(f\"Lyrics save failed: {e}\")\n            else:\n                print(f\"  Error message: {lyrics.get('errorMessage')}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Lyrics generation failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or content violation\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"File download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['taskId'] ?? '';\n$callbackType = $callbackData['callbackType'] ?? '';\n$lyricsData = $callbackData['data'] ?? [];\n\nerror_log(\"Received lyrics generation callback: $taskId, type: $callbackType, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Lyrics generation completed\");\n    \n    error_log(\"Generated \" . count($lyricsData) . \" lyrics variants:\");\n    foreach ($lyricsData as $index => $lyrics) {\n        error_log(\"Lyrics variant \" . ($index + 1) . \":\");\n        error_log(\"  Title: \" . ($lyrics['title'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Status: \" . ($lyrics['status'] ?? ''));\n        \n        if (($lyrics['status'] ?? '') === 'complete') {\n            error_log(\"  Lyrics content:\\n\" . ($lyrics['text'] ?? ''));\n            \n            // Save lyrics to file example\n            try {\n                $filename = \"lyrics_{$taskId}_\" . ($index + 1) . \".txt\";\n                $content = \"Title: \" . ($lyrics['title'] ?? '') . \"\\n\\n\" . ($lyrics['text'] ?? '');\n                file_put_contents($filename, $content);\n                error_log(\"Lyrics saved as $filename\");\n            } catch (Exception $e) {\n                error_log(\"Lyrics save failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n            }\n        } else {\n            error_log(\"  Error message: \" . ($lyrics['errorMessage'] ?? ''));\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Lyrics generation failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or content violation\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"File download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get lyrics generation details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-lyrics-generation-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/upload-and-extend-audio-callbacks\n\n# Upload and Extend Audio Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Upload and Extend Audio API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Audio extension task completed successfully\n*   Audio extension task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Audio extension completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, unsupported audio file format, content violation, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download source audio file\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.callbackType\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nCallback type indicating the current callback stage:\n\n*   `text`: Text generation completed\n*   `first`: First music track completed\n*   `complete`: All music tracks completed\n*   `error`: Task failed\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.data\n\narray\n\nAudio extension result information, returned on success\n\ndata.data\\[\\].id\n\nstring\n\nMusic unique identifier\n\ndata.data\\[\\].audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nExtended audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nStreaming audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal streaming audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nCover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal cover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].prompt\n\nstring\n\nGeneration prompt/lyrics\n\ndata.data\\[\\].model\\_name\n\nstring\n\nModel name used\n\ndata.data\\[\\].title\n\nstring\n\nMusic title\n\ndata.data\\[\\].tags\n\nstring\n\nMusic tags\n\ndata.data\\[\\].createTime\n\nstring\n\nCreation time\n\ndata.data\\[\\].duration\n\nnumber\n\nAudio duration (seconds)\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/upload-extend-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received audio extension callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    callbackType: data.callbackType,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Audio extension completed');\n    const musicData = data.data || [];\n    \n    console.log(`Extended ${musicData.length} music tracks:`);\n    musicData.forEach((music, index) => {\n      console.log(`Extended music ${index + 1}:`);\n      console.log(`  Title: ${music.title}`);\n      console.log(`  Duration: ${music.duration} seconds`);\n      console.log(`  Style tags: ${music.tags}`);\n      console.log(`  Extended audio URL: ${music.audio_url}`);\n      console.log(`  Cover URL: ${music.image_url}`);\n    });\n    \n    // Process extended music\n    // Can download audio files, save locally, etc.\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Audio extension failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or content violation');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('Source audio file download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/upload-extend-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    callback_type = callback_data.get('callbackType')\n    music_data = callback_data.get('data', [])\n    \n    print(f\"Received audio extension callback: {task_id}, type: {callback_type}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Audio extension completed\")\n        \n        print(f\"Extended {len(music_data)} music tracks:\")\n        for i, music in enumerate(music_data):\n            print(f\"Extended music {i + 1}:\")\n            print(f\"  Title: {music.get('title')}\")\n            print(f\"  Duration: {music.get('duration')} seconds\")\n            print(f\"  Style tags: {music.get('tags')}\")\n            print(f\"  Extended audio URL: {music.get('audio_url')}\")\n            print(f\"  Cover URL: {music.get('image_url')}\")\n            \n            # Download extended audio file example\n            try:\n                audio_url = music.get('audio_url')\n                if audio_url:\n                    response = requests.get(audio_url)\n                    if response.status_code == 200:\n                        filename = f\"extended_music_{task_id}_{i + 1}.mp3\"\n                        with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                            f.write(response.content)\n                        print(f\"Extended audio saved as {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"Audio download failed: {e}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Audio extension failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or content violation\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"Source audio file download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$callbackType = $callbackData['callbackType'] ?? '';\n$musicData = $callbackData['data'] ?? [];\n\nerror_log(\"Received audio extension callback: $taskId, type: $callbackType, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Audio extension completed\");\n    \n    error_log(\"Extended \" . count($musicData) . \" music tracks:\");\n    foreach ($musicData as $index => $music) {\n        error_log(\"Extended music \" . ($index + 1) . \":\");\n        error_log(\"  Title: \" . ($music['title'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Duration: \" . ($music['duration'] ?? 0) . \" seconds\");\n        error_log(\"  Style tags: \" . ($music['tags'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Extended audio URL: \" . ($music['audio_url'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Cover URL: \" . ($music['image_url'] ?? ''));\n        \n        // Download extended audio file example\n        try {\n            $audioUrl = $music['audio_url'] ?? '';\n            if ($audioUrl) {\n                $audioContent = file_get_contents($audioUrl);\n                if ($audioContent !== false) {\n                    $filename = \"extended_music_{$taskId}_\" . ($index + 1) . \".mp3\";\n                    file_put_contents($filename, $audioContent);\n                    error_log(\"Extended audio saved as $filename\");\n                }\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"Audio download failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Audio extension failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or content violation\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"Source audio file download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get music generation details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-music-generation-details)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-lyrics\n\n# Generate Lyrics - Suno API\n\nGenerate Lyrics\n\nGenerate Lyrics\n\nCreate lyrics for music using AI models without generating audio tracks.\n\n### Usage Guide\n\n*   This endpoint generates only lyrics content based on your prompt\n*   Multiple lyrics variations will be returned for you to choose from\n*   Generated lyrics typically include song structure markers (e.g., \\[Verse\\], \\[Chorus\\])\n\n### Developer Notes\n\n1.  Generated lyrics are retained for 15 days\n2.  Callback has only one stage: complete (generation complete)\n3.  Use this endpoint when you only need lyrics creation without music\n4.  Results can be used as input for the Generate Music endpoint in custom mode\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n## ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\nprompt\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nDetailed description of the desired lyrics content.\n\n*   Be specific about themes, moods, styles, and song structure you want.\n*   The more detailed your prompt, the more closely the generated lyrics will match your vision.\n*   The maximum word limit is 200 words.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"A song about peaceful night in the city\"`\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive lyrics generation results when complete.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Unlike music generation, lyrics callback has only one stage: `complete` (generation finished).\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Lyrics Generation Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-lyrics-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the get lyrics generation details endpoint to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\nRequest successful\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n## Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options\n\n:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nExample:\n\n`200`\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Generate Persona](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-persona)[Lyrics Generation Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-lyrics-callbacks)\n\n---\n\n## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/generate-music\n\n# Generate Suno AI Music - Suno API\n\n[![light
