"Content": "## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/replace-section-callbacks\n\n# Replace Music Section Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a replace music section task to the API, you can provide a `callBackUrl` to receive real-time notifications about task progress and completion.\n\n## Callback Mechanism\n\n### When Callbacks Are Sent\n\nThe system sends callbacks at the following times:\n\n*   **Complete**: When the replacement task is fully completed\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content-Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout**: 10 seconds\n*   **Retry Policy**: Up to 3 attempts with exponential backoff\n\n## Request Format\n\n### Success Callback\n\nWhen the replacement task completes successfully:\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"All generated successfully.\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"callbackType\": \"complete\",\n    \"task_id\": \"2fac****9f72\",\n    \"data\": [\n      {\n        \"id\": \"e231****-****-****-****-****8cadc7dc\",\n        \"audio_url\": \"https://example.cn/****.mp3\",\n        \"stream_audio_url\": \"https://example.cn/****\",\n        \"image_url\": \"https://example.cn/****.jpeg\",\n        \"prompt\": \"A calm and relaxing piano track.\",\n        \"model_name\": \"chirp-v3-5\",\n        \"title\": \"Relaxing Piano\",\n        \"tags\": \"Jazz\",\n        \"createTime\": \"2025-01-01 00:00:00\",\n        \"duration\": 198.44\n      }\n    ]\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### Failure Callback\n\nWhen the replacement task fails:\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 501,\n  \"msg\": \"Audio generation failed.\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"callbackType\": \"error\",\n    \"task_id\": \"2fac****9f72\",\n    \"error\": \"Generation failed due to technical issues\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Status Codes\n\nCode\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Task completed successfully\n\n400\n\nValidation error - Parameter validation failed\n\n408\n\nTimeout - Request timeout\n\n500\n\nServer error - Unexpected error occurred\n\n501\n\nAudio generation failed\n\n531\n\nServer error - Generation failed, credits refunded\n\n## Response Fields\n\n### Success Response Fields\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nStatus code indicating the result of the replacement task\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message describing the result\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nrequired\n\nContainer for callback data\n\nShow Data object properties\n\ncallbackType\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nType of callback: `complete` or `error`\n\ntask\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe task ID for the replacement request\n\ndata\n\narray\n\nArray of replaced music data (only present on success)\n\nShow Music data properties\n\nid\n\nstring\n\nUnique identifier for the music segment\n\naudio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nDirect URL to the audio file\n\nstream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nStreaming URL for the audio\n\nimage\\_url\n\nstring\n\nURL to the cover image\n\nprompt\n\nstring\n\nThe prompt used for generating the replacement\n\nmodel\\_name\n\nstring\n\nName of the AI model used\n\ntitle\n\nstring\n\nTitle of the music\n\ntags\n\nstring\n\nStyle tags for the music\n\ncreateTime\n\nstring\n\nCreation timestamp\n\nduration\n\nnumber\n\nDuration of the audio in seconds\n\n## Implementation Examples\n\n### Node.js (Express)\n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/replace-section-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Replace section callback received:', {\n    code,\n    msg,\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    callbackType: data.callbackType\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200 && data.callbackType === 'complete') {\n    // Handle successful replacement\n    console.log('Replacement completed successfully');\n    data.data.forEach((music, index) => {\n      console.log(`Music ${index + 1}:`, {\n        id: music.id,\n        title: music.title,\n        duration: music.duration,\n        audioUrl: music.audio_url\n      });\n    });\n  } else {\n    // Handle failure\n    console.log('Replacement failed:', msg);\n  }\n  \n  // Always respond with success to acknowledge receipt\n  res.json({ code: 200, msg: 'success' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n### Python (Flask)\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport logging\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\nlogging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)\n\n@app.route('/replace-section-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef replace_section_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    \n    logging.info(f\"Replace section callback received: code={code}, msg={msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200 and callback_data.get('callbackType') == 'complete':\n        # Handle successful replacement\n        logging.info(\"Replacement completed successfully\")\n        music_data = callback_data.get('data', [])\n        for i, music in enumerate(music_data):\n            logging.info(f\"Music {i + 1}: {music.get('title')} - {music.get('duration')}s\")\n    else:\n        # Handle failure\n        logging.error(f\"Replacement failed: {msg}\")\n    \n    # Always respond with success\n    return jsonify({\"code\": 200, \"msg\": \"success\"})\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n### PHP\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get the raw POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\nif ($data === null) {\n    http_response_code(400);\n    echo json_encode(['code' => 400, 'msg' => 'Invalid JSON']);\n    exit;\n}\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n\nerror_log(\"Replace section callback received: code=$code, msg=$msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200 && ($callbackData['callbackType'] ?? '') === 'complete') {\n    // Handle successful replacement\n    error_log(\"Replacement completed successfully\");\n    $musicData = $callbackData['data'] ?? [];\n    foreach ($musicData as $index => $music) {\n        $title = $music['title'] ?? 'Unknown';\n        $duration = $music['duration'] ?? 0;\n        error_log(\"Music \" . ($index + 1) . \": $title - {$duration}s\");\n    }\n} else {\n    // Handle failure\n    error_log(\"Replacement failed: $msg\");\n}\n\n// Always respond with success\necho json_encode(['code' => 200, 'msg' => 'success']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Callback Security\n\n### Verification Recommendations\n\n1.  **IP Whitelist**: Restrict callback endpoints to known IP addresses\n2.  **HTTPS Only**: Always use HTTPS for callback URLs in production\n3.  **Request Validation**: Validate the structure and content of callback requests\n4.  **Timeout Handling**: Implement proper timeout handling for callback processing\n\n### Example Security Implementation\n\n```\nconst crypto = require('crypto');\n\nfunction verifyCallback(req, res, next) {\n  // Verify request structure\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  if (typeof code !== 'number' || typeof msg !== 'string' || !data) {\n    return res.status(400).json({ code: 400, msg: 'Invalid callback format' });\n  }\n  \n  // Verify task ID format\n  const taskId = data.task_id;\n  if (!taskId || !/^[a-f0-9\\*]{12}$/.test(taskId)) {\n    return res.status(400).json({ code: 400, msg: 'Invalid task ID' });\n  }\n  \n  next();\n}\n\napp.post('/replace-section-callback', verifyCallback, (req, res) => {\n  // Process verified callback\n  // ... callback handling logic\n});\n```\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\n### Common Issues\n\n**Q: Callbacks are not being received**\n\n*   Verify your callback URL is publicly accessible\n*   Check that your server is responding within 10 seconds\n*   Ensure your endpoint accepts POST requests with JSON content\n\n**Q: Receiving duplicate callbacks**\n\n*   This can happen due to network issues or timeouts\n*   Implement idempotency using the task\\_id to handle duplicates\n\n**Q: Callback data is missing or incomplete**\n\n*   Check the `callbackType` field to understand the callback stage\n*   For error callbacks, check the error message for details\n\n**Q: How to handle callback failures?**\n\n*   Always return a 200 status code to acknowledge receipt\n*   Use the [Get Music Details](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-music-details) endpoint to poll task status as a fallback\n\n### Best Practices\n\n1.  **Always Acknowledge**: Return HTTP 200 even if your processing fails\n2.  **Implement Retry Logic**: Handle temporary failures gracefully\n3.  **Log Everything**: Keep detailed logs for debugging\n4.  **Use Fallback Polling**: Donâ€™t rely solely on callbacks for critical workflows\n5.  **Validate Data**: Always validate callback data before processing",

åŸºäºŽå…ˆè¿›çš„AIæ¨¡åž‹ï¼Œä¸ºæ‚¨æä¾›å…¨é¢çš„éŸ³ä¹ç”Ÿæˆå’ŒéŸ³é¢‘å¤„ç†æœåŠ¡ã€‚æ— è®ºæ‚¨éœ€è¦éŸ³ä¹åˆ›ä½œã€æ­Œè¯ç”Ÿæˆã€éŸ³é¢‘ç¼–è¾‘è¿˜æ˜¯äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬çš„APIéƒ½èƒ½æ»¡è¶³æ‚¨çš„æ‰€æœ‰åˆ›æ„éœ€æ±‚ã€‚\n\n## èº«ä»½éªŒè¯\n\næ‰€æœ‰ API è¯·æ±‚éƒ½éœ€è¦ä½¿ç”¨ Bearer ä»¤ç‰Œè¿›è¡Œèº«ä»½éªŒè¯ã€‚è¯·ä»Ž [API å¯†é’¥ç®¡ç†é¡µé¢](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) èŽ·å–æ‚¨çš„ API å¯†é’¥ã€‚\n\n### API åŸºç¡€ URL\n\n```\nhttps://api.sunoapi.org\n```\n\n### èº«ä»½éªŒè¯è¯·æ±‚å¤´\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n## å¿«é€Ÿå¼€å§‹æŒ‡å—\n\n### ç¬¬ä¸€æ­¥ï¼šç”Ÿæˆæ‚¨çš„ç¬¬ä¸€é¦–æ­Œæ›²\n\nä»Žä¸€ä¸ªç®€å•çš„éŸ³ä¹ç”Ÿæˆè¯·æ±‚å¼€å§‹ï¼š\n\n### ç¬¬äºŒæ­¥ï¼šæ£€æŸ¥ä»»åŠ¡çŠ¶æ€\n\nä½¿ç”¨è¿”å›žçš„ä»»åŠ¡IDæ£€æŸ¥ç”ŸæˆçŠ¶æ€ï¼š\n\n### å“åº”æ ¼å¼\n\n**æˆåŠŸå“åº”ï¼š**\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"suno_task_abc123\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n**ä»»åŠ¡çŠ¶æ€å“åº”ï¼š**\n\n```\n{\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"success\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"taskId\": \"suno_task_abc123\",\n    \"status\": \"SUCCESS\",\n    \"response\": {\n      \"data\": [\n        {\n          \"id\": \"audio_123\",\n          \"audio_url\": \"https://example.com/generated-music.mp3\",\n          \"title\": \"ç”Ÿæˆçš„æ­Œæ›²\",\n          \"tags\": \"æ°‘è°£, åŽŸå£°\",\n          \"duration\": 180.5\n        }\n      ]\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## æ ¸å¿ƒåŠŸèƒ½\n\n### éŸ³ä¹ç”Ÿæˆ\n\nä»Žæ–‡æœ¬æè¿°åˆ›å»ºå®Œæ•´æ­Œæ›²ï¼š\n\n```\n{\n  \"prompt\": \"ä¸€é¦–å……æ»¡æ´»åŠ›çš„ç”µå­èˆžæ›²ï¼Œå¸¦æœ‰åˆæˆå™¨ä¸»éŸ³\",\n  \"customMode\": true,\n  \"style\": \"ç”µå­èˆžæ›²\",\n  \"title\": \"æ•°å­—æ¢¦å¢ƒ\",\n  \"instrumental\": false,\n  \"model\": \"V4_5\"\n}\n```\n\n### æ­Œè¯åˆ›ä½œ\n\nç‹¬ç«‹ç”ŸæˆAIé©±åŠ¨çš„æ­Œè¯ï¼š\n\n```\n{\n  \"prompt\": \"ä¸€é¦–å…³äºŽå…‹æœæŒ‘æˆ˜å’Œæ‰¾åˆ°å†…åœ¨åŠ›é‡çš„æ­Œæ›²\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://your-server.com/lyrics-callback\"\n}\n```\n\n### éŸ³é¢‘æ‰©å±•\n\næ‰©å±•çŽ°æœ‰éŸ³ä¹è½¨é“ï¼š\n\n```\n{\n  \"audioId\": \"e231****-****-****-****-****8cadc7dc\",\n  \"defaultParamFlag\": true,\n  \"prompt\": \"ç»§ç»­æ·»åŠ å‰ä»–ç‹¬å¥\",\n  \"continueAt\": 120,\n  \"model\": \"V4_5ALL\"\n}\n```\n\n### ä¸Šä¼ ç¿»å”±\n\nç”¨æ–°é£Žæ ¼è½¬æ¢çŽ°æœ‰éŸ³é¢‘ï¼š\n\n```\n{\n  \"uploadUrl\": \"https://example.com/original-audio.mp3\",\n  \"customMode\": true,\n  \"style\": \"çˆµå£«\",\n  \"title\": \"çˆµå£«ç‰ˆæœ¬\",\n  \"prompt\": \"è½¬æ¢ä¸ºæµç•…çš„çˆµå£«é£Žæ ¼\"\n}\n```\n\n## æ¨¡åž‹ç‰ˆæœ¬\n\nä¸ºæ‚¨çš„éœ€æ±‚é€‰æ‹©åˆé€‚çš„æ¨¡åž‹ï¼š\n\n## å…³é”®å‚æ•°\n\nprompt\n\nstring\n\néŸ³ä¹ç”Ÿæˆçš„æ–‡æœ¬æè¿°ã€‚æä¾›è¯¦ç»†ã€å…·ä½“çš„æè¿°ä»¥èŽ·å¾—æ›´å¥½çš„ç»“æžœã€‚**æ ¹æ®æ¨¡åž‹çš„å­—ç¬¦é™åˆ¶ï¼š**\n\n*   V4ï¼šæœ€å¤š 3000 å­—ç¬¦\n*   V4\\_5ã€V4\\_5PLUSã€V4\\_5ALLã€V5ï¼šæœ€å¤š 5000 å­—ç¬¦\n\n**æç¤ºè¯æŠ€å·§ï¼š**\n\n*   æè¿°éŸ³ä¹é£Žæ ¼å’Œæµæ´¾\n*   åŒ…å«æƒ…ç»ªå’Œæ°›å›´\n*   æŒ‡å®šä¹å™¨å’Œäººå£°\n*   æ·»åŠ èŠ‚æ‹å’Œèƒ½é‡æè¿°\n\nmodel\n\nstring\n\nå¿…å¡«\n\nè¦ä½¿ç”¨çš„æ¨¡åž‹ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š\n\n*   `V4` - æœ€ä½³éŸ³é¢‘è´¨é‡ï¼Œæœ€é•¿4åˆ†é’Ÿ\n*   `V4_5` - é«˜çº§åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œæœ€é•¿8åˆ†é’Ÿ\n*   `V4_5PLUS` - æ›´ä¸°å¯ŒéŸ³è‰²ï¼Œæœ€é•¿8åˆ†é’Ÿ\n*   `V4_5ALL` - V4.5-all æ›´å¥½çš„æ­Œæ›²ç»“æž„ï¼Œæœ€é•¿8åˆ†é’Ÿ\n*   `V5` - ç”Ÿæˆé€Ÿåº¦æ›´å¿«ï¼Œæ›´å“è¶ŠéŸ³ä¹è¡¨çŽ°åŠ›ï¼Œæœ€é•¿8åˆ†é’Ÿ\n\ncustomMode\n\nboolean\n\nå¯ç”¨è‡ªå®šä¹‰å‚æ•°æ¨¡å¼ä»¥è¿›è¡Œé«˜çº§æŽ§åˆ¶ã€‚å½“ä¸º `true` æ—¶ï¼Œéœ€è¦é¢å¤–çš„å‚æ•°å¦‚ `style` å’Œ `title`ã€‚\n\ninstrumental\n\nboolean\n\nç”Ÿæˆæ— äººå£°çš„çº¯éŸ³ä¹ã€‚é»˜è®¤ä¸º `false`ã€‚\n\nstyle\n\nstring\n\néŸ³ä¹é£Žæ ¼æˆ–æµæ´¾ï¼ˆè‡ªå®šä¹‰æ¨¡å¼ä¸‹å¿…éœ€ï¼‰ã€‚ç¤ºä¾‹ï¼šâ€œçˆµå£«â€ã€â€œæ‘‡æ»šâ€ã€â€œå¤å…¸â€ã€â€œç”µå­â€**æ ¹æ®æ¨¡åž‹çš„å­—ç¬¦é™åˆ¶ï¼š**\n\n*   V4ï¼šæœ€å¤š 200 å­—ç¬¦\n*   V4\\_5ã€V4\\_5PLUSã€V4\\_5ALLã€V5ï¼šæœ€å¤š 1000 å­—ç¬¦\n\ntitle\n\nstring\n\næ­Œæ›²æ ‡é¢˜ï¼ˆè‡ªå®šä¹‰æ¨¡å¼ä¸‹å¿…éœ€ï¼‰ã€‚æ ¹æ®æ¨¡åž‹çš„å­—ç¬¦é™åˆ¶ï¼š\n\n*   V4 å’Œ V4\\_5ALLï¼šæœ€å¤š 80 å­—ç¬¦\n*   V4\\_5ã€V4\\_5PLUSã€V5ï¼šæœ€å¤š 100 å­—ç¬¦\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring\n\næŽ¥æ”¶å®Œæˆé€šçŸ¥çš„URLã€‚è¯¦è§å›žè°ƒæ–‡æ¡£ã€‚\n\n## å®Œæ•´å·¥ä½œæµç¨‹ç¤ºä¾‹\n\nä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯å®Œæ•´çš„éŸ³ä¹ç”Ÿæˆå’Œå¤„ç†ç¤ºä¾‹ï¼š\n\n*   JavaScript\n    \n*   Python\n    \n\n```\nclass SunoAPI {\n  constructor(apiKey) {\n    this.apiKey = apiKey;\n    this.baseUrl = 'https://api.sunoapi.org/api/v1';\n  }\n  \n  async generateMusic(options) {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/generate`, {\n      method: 'POST',\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`,\n        'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n      },\n      body: JSON.stringify(options)\n    });\n    \n    const result = await response.json();\n    if (result.code !== 200) {\n      throw new Error(`ç”Ÿæˆå¤±è´¥: ${result.msg}`);\n    }\n    \n    return result.data.taskId;\n  }\n  \n  async generateLyrics(prompt) {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/lyrics`, {\n      method: 'POST',\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`,\n        'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n      },\n      body: JSON.stringify({\n        prompt,\n        callBackUrl: 'https://your-server.com/lyrics-callback'\n      })\n    });\n    \n    const result = await response.json();\n    return result.data.taskId;\n  }\n  \n  async waitForCompletion(taskId, maxWaitTime = 600000) { // æœ€é•¿ç­‰å¾…10åˆ†é’Ÿ\n    const startTime = Date.now();\n    \n    while (Date.now() - startTime < maxWaitTime) {\n      const status = await this.getTaskStatus(taskId);\n      \n      if (status.status === 'SUCCESS') {\n        return status.response;\n      } else if (status.status === 'FAILED') {\n        throw new Error(`ç”Ÿæˆå¤±è´¥: ${status.errorMessage}`);\n      }\n      \n      // ç­‰å¾…30ç§’åŽå†æ¬¡æ£€æŸ¥\n      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 30000));\n    }\n    \n    throw new Error('ç”Ÿæˆè¶…æ—¶');\n  }\n  \n  async getTaskStatus(taskId) {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/generate/record-info?taskId=${taskId}`, {\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`\n      }\n    });\n    \n    const result = await response.json();\n    return result.data;\n  }\n  \n  async extendMusic(audioId, options) {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/generate/extend`, {\n      method: 'POST',\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`,\n        'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n      },\n      body: JSON.stringify({\n        audioId,\n        ...options\n      })\n    });\n    \n    const result = await response.json();\n    return result.data.taskId;\n  }\n  \n  async separateVocals(taskId, audioId) {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/vocal-removal/generate`, {\n      method: 'POST',\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`,\n        'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n      },\n      body: JSON.stringify({\n        taskId,\n        audioId,\n        callBackUrl: 'https://your-server.com/vocal-callback'\n      })\n    });\n    \n    const result = await response.json();\n    return result.data.taskId;\n  }\n  \n  async getRemainingCredits() {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/get-credits`, {\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`\n      }\n    });\n    \n    const result = await response.json();\n    return result.data.credits;\n  }\n}\n\n// ä½¿ç”¨ç¤ºä¾‹\nasync function main() {\n  const api = new SunoAPI('YOUR_API_KEY');\n  \n  try {\n    // æ£€æŸ¥å‰©ä½™ç§¯åˆ†\n    const credits = await api.getRemainingCredits();\n    console.log(`å‰©ä½™ç§¯åˆ†: ${credits}`);\n    \n    // é¦–å…ˆç”Ÿæˆæ­Œè¯\n    console.log('æ­£åœ¨ç”Ÿæˆæ­Œè¯...');\n    const lyricsTaskId = await api.generateLyrics(\n      'ä¸€é¦–å…³äºŽå†’é™©å’Œå‘çŽ°çš„æ­Œæ›²ï¼ŒæŒ¯å¥‹äººå¿ƒä¸”é¼“èˆžäººå¿ƒ'\n    );\n    \n    const lyricsResult = await api.waitForCompletion(lyricsTaskId);\n    console.log('æ­Œè¯å·²ç”Ÿæˆ:', lyricsResult.data[0].text);\n    \n    // ä½¿ç”¨è‡ªå®šä¹‰å‚æ•°ç”ŸæˆéŸ³ä¹\n    console.log('æ­£åœ¨ç”ŸæˆéŸ³ä¹...');\n    const musicTaskId = await api.generateMusic({\n      prompt: lyricsResult.data[0].text,\n      customMode: true,\n      style: 'æ°‘è°£æµè¡Œ',\n      title: 'å†’é™©ä¹‹æ­Œ',\n      instrumental: false,\n      model: 'V4_5',\n      callBackUrl: 'https://your-server.com/music-callback'\n    });\n    \n    // ç­‰å¾…å®Œæˆ\n    const musicResult = await api.waitForCompletion(musicTaskId);\n    console.log('éŸ³ä¹ç”ŸæˆæˆåŠŸï¼');\n    \n    musicResult.data.forEach((track, index) => {\n      console.log(`éŸ³è½¨ ${index + 1}:`);\n      console.log(`  æ ‡é¢˜: ${track.title}`);\n      console.log(`  æ—¶é•¿: ${track.duration}ç§’`);\n      console.log(`  éŸ³é¢‘URL: ${track.audio_url}`);\n    });\n    \n    // æ‰©å±•ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªéŸ³è½¨\n    const originalTrack = musicResult.data[0];\n    console.log('æ­£åœ¨æ‰©å±•éŸ³ä¹...');\n    const extendTaskId = await api.extendMusic(originalTrack.id, {\n      defaultParamFlag: true,\n      prompt: 'ç»§ç»­æ·»åŠ ç¾Žå¦™çš„å™¨ä¹å°¾å¥',\n      continueAt: originalTrack.duration - 30, // ä»Žç»“æŸå‰30ç§’å¼€å§‹æ‰©å±•\n      model: 'V4_5'\n    });\n    \n    const extendedResult = await api.waitForCompletion(extendTaskId);\n    console.log('æ‰©å±•ç‰ˆæœ¬å·²åˆ›å»º:', extendedResult.data[0].audio_url);\n    \n    // åˆ†ç¦»äººå£°\n    console.log('æ­£åœ¨åˆ†ç¦»äººå£°...');\n    const separationTaskId = await api.separateVocals(musicTaskId, originalTrack.id);\n    const separationResult = await api.waitForCompletion(separationTaskId);\n    \n    console.log('äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»å®Œæˆ:');\n    console.log(`  ä¼´å¥: ${separationResult.vocal_removal_info.instrumental_url}`);\n    console.log(`  çº¯äººå£°: ${separationResult.vocal_removal_info.vocal_url}`);\n    \n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('é”™è¯¯:', error.message);\n  }\n}\n\nmain();\n```\n\n```\nimport requests\nimport time\n\nclass SunoAPI:\n    def __init__(self, api_key):\n        self.api_key = api_key\n        self.base_url = 'https://api.sunoapi.org/api/v1'\n        self.headers = {\n            'Authorization': f'Bearer {api_key}',\n            'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n        }\n    \n    def generate_music(self, **options):\n        response = requests.post(f'{self.base_url}/generate', \n                               headers=self.headers, json=options)\n        result = response.json()\n        \n        if result['code'] != 200:\n            raise Exception(f\"ç”Ÿæˆå¤±è´¥: {result['msg']}\")\n        \n        return result['data']['taskId']\n    \n    def generate_lyrics(self, prompt):\n        response = requests.post(f'{self.base_url}/lyrics',\n                               headers=self.headers,\n                               json={\n                                   'prompt': prompt,\n                                   'callBackUrl': 'https://your-server.com/lyrics-callback'\n                               })\n        result = response.json()\n        return result['data']['taskId']\n    \n    def wait_for_completion(self, task_id, max_wait_time=600):\n        start_time = time.time()\n        \n        while time.time() - start_time < max_wait_time:\n            status = self.get_task_status(task_id)\n            \n            if status['status'] == 'SUCCESS':\n                return status['response']\n            elif status['status'] == 'FAILED':\n                raise Exception(f\"ç”Ÿæˆå¤±è´¥: {status.get('errorMessage')}\")\n            \n            time.sleep(30)  # ç­‰å¾…30ç§’\n        \n        raise Exception('ç”Ÿæˆè¶…æ—¶')\n    \n    def get_task_status(self, task_id):\n        response = requests.get(f'{self.base_url}/generate/record-info?taskId={task_id}',\n                              headers={'Authorization': f'Bearer {self.api_key}'})\n        return response.json()['data']\n    \n    def extend_music(self, audio_id, **options):\n        response = requests.post(f'{self.base_url}/generate/extend',\n                               headers=self.headers,\n                               json={'audioId': audio_id, **options})\n        return response.json()['data']['taskId']\n    \n    def separate_vocals(self, task_id, audio_id):\n        response = requests.post(f'{self.base_url}/vocal-removal/generate',\n                               headers=self.headers,\n                               json={\n                                   'taskId': task_id,\n                                   'audioId': audio_id,\n                                   'callBackUrl': 'https://your-server.com/vocal-callback'\n                               })\n        return response.json()['data']['taskId']\n    \n    def get_remaining_credits(self):\n        response = requests.get(f'{self.base_url}/get-credits',\n                              headers={'Authorization': f'Bearer {self.api_key}'})\n        return response.json()['data']['credits']\n\n# ä½¿ç”¨ç¤ºä¾‹\ndef main():\n    api = SunoAPI('YOUR_API_KEY')\n    \n    try:\n        # æ£€æŸ¥å‰©ä½™ç§¯åˆ†\n        credits = api.get_remaining_credits()\n        print(f'å‰©ä½™ç§¯åˆ†: {credits}')\n        \n        # é¦–å…ˆç”Ÿæˆæ­Œè¯\n        print('æ­£åœ¨ç”Ÿæˆæ­Œè¯...')\n        lyrics_task_id = api.generate_lyrics(\n            'ä¸€é¦–å…³äºŽå†’é™©å’Œå‘çŽ°çš„æ­Œæ›²ï¼ŒæŒ¯å¥‹äººå¿ƒä¸”é¼“èˆžäººå¿ƒ'\n        )\n        \n        lyrics_result = api.wait_for_completion(lyrics_task_id)\n        print('æ­Œè¯å·²ç”Ÿæˆ:', lyrics_result['data'][0]['text'])\n        \n        # ä½¿ç”¨è‡ªå®šä¹‰å‚æ•°ç”ŸæˆéŸ³ä¹\n        print('æ­£åœ¨ç”ŸæˆéŸ³ä¹...')\n        music_task_id = api.generate_music(\n            prompt=lyrics_result['data'][0]['text'],\n            customMode=True,\n            style='æ°‘è°£æµè¡Œ',\n            title='å†’é™©ä¹‹æ­Œ',\n            instrumental=False,\n            model='V4_5',\n            callBackUrl='https://your-server.com/music-callback'\n        )\n        \n        # ç­‰å¾…å®Œæˆ\n        music_result = api.wait_for_completion(music_task_id)\n        print('éŸ³ä¹ç”ŸæˆæˆåŠŸï¼')\n        \n        for i, track in enumerate(music_result['data']):\n            print(f'éŸ³è½¨ {i + 1}:')\n            print(f'  æ ‡é¢˜: {track[\"title\"]}')\n            print(f'  æ—¶é•¿: {track[\"duration\"]}ç§’')\n            print(f'  éŸ³é¢‘URL: {track[\"audio_url\"]}')\n        \n        # æ‰©å±•ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªéŸ³è½¨\n        original_track = music_result['data'][0]\n        print('æ­£åœ¨æ‰©å±•éŸ³ä¹...')\n        extend_task_id = api.extend_music(\n            original_track['id'],\n            defaultParamFlag=True,\n            prompt='ç»§ç»­æ·»åŠ ç¾Žå¦™çš„å™¨ä¹å°¾å¥',\n            continueAt=original_track['duration'] - 30,\n            model='V4_5'\n        )\n        \n        extended_result = api.wait_for_completion(extend_task_id)\n        print('æ‰©å±•ç‰ˆæœ¬å·²åˆ›å»º:', extended_result['data'][0]['audio_url'])\n        \n        # åˆ†ç¦»äººå£°\n        print('æ­£åœ¨åˆ†ç¦»äººå£°...')\n        separation_task_id = api.separate_vocals(music_task_id, original_track['id'])\n        separation_result = api.wait_for_completion(separation_task_id)\n        \n        print('äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»å®Œæˆ:')\n        vocal_info = separation_result['vocal_removal_info']\n        print(f'  ä¼´å¥: {vocal_info[\"instrumental_url\"]}')\n        print(f'  çº¯äººå£°: {vocal_info[\"vocal_url\"]}')\n        \n    except Exception as error:\n        print(f'é”™è¯¯: {error}')\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    main()\n```\n\n## é«˜çº§åŠŸèƒ½\n\n### ä¸Šä¼ å¹¶æ‰©å±•\n\nä¸Šä¼ æ‚¨è‡ªå·±çš„éŸ³é¢‘å¹¶ç”¨AIæ‰©å±•ï¼š\n\n```\nconst extendTaskId = await api.generateMusic({\n  uploadUrl: 'https://example.com/my-song.mp3',\n  defaultParamFlag: true,\n  prompt: 'æ·»åŠ æ‘‡æ»šå‰ä»–ç‹¬å¥éƒ¨åˆ†',\n  continueAt: 60,\n  model: 'V4_5'\n});\n```\n\n### éŸ³é¢‘æ ¼å¼è½¬æ¢\n\nå°†éŸ³ä¹è½¬æ¢ä¸ºé«˜è´¨é‡WAVæ ¼å¼ï¼š\n\n```\nconst wavTaskId = await \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#å®žçŽ°å›žè°ƒå¤„ç†å™¨)\n\nå®žçŽ°å›žè°ƒå¤„ç†å™¨\n\nä»¥ä¸‹ç¤ºä¾‹å±•ç¤ºå¦‚ä½•å®žçŽ°å›žè°ƒå¤„ç†å™¨ï¼š\n\nNode.js\n\nPython Flask\n\nPHP\n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/suno-replace-section-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('æ”¶åˆ°æ›¿æ¢åˆ†åŒºå›žè°ƒ:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    type: data.callbackType,\n    status: code\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200 && data.callbackType === 'complete') {\n    // æ›¿æ¢ä»»åŠ¡æˆåŠŸå®Œæˆ\n    const musicData = data.data;\n    \n    if (musicData && musicData.length > 0) {\n      musicData.forEach((music, index) => {\n        console.log(`æ›¿æ¢åŽçš„éŸ³ä¹ ${index + 1}:`, {\n          id: music.id,\n          title: music.title,\n          audioUrl: music.audio_url,\n          duration: music.duration\n        });\n        \n        // å¤„ç†æ›¿æ¢åŽçš„éŸ³ä¹\n        saveReplacedMusic(music);\n      });\n    }\n  } else {\n    // æ›¿æ¢ä»»åŠ¡å¤±è´¥\n    console.error('æ›¿æ¢åˆ†åŒºå¤±è´¥:', msg);\n    handleReplacementError(data.task_id, msg);\n  }\n  \n  // è¿”å›ž200ç¡®è®¤æ”¶åˆ°å›žè°ƒ\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\nfunction saveReplacedMusic(music) {\n  // å®žçŽ°æ‚¨çš„ä¿å­˜é€»è¾‘\n  console.log('ä¿å­˜æ›¿æ¢åŽçš„éŸ³ä¹:', music.title);\n}\n\nfunction handleReplacementError(taskId, errorMsg) {\n  // å®žçŽ°æ‚¨çš„é”™è¯¯å¤„ç†é€»è¾‘\n  console.error(`ä»»åŠ¡ ${taskId} å¤±è´¥:`, errorMsg);\n}\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('å›žè°ƒæœåŠ¡å™¨è¿è¡Œåœ¨ç«¯å£ 3000');\n});\n```\n\n## \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#å›žè°ƒå®‰å…¨å»ºè®®)\n\nå›žè°ƒå®‰å…¨å»ºè®®\n\nä¸ºç¡®ä¿å›žè°ƒçš„å®‰å…¨æ€§ï¼Œå»ºè®®å®žæ–½ä»¥ä¸‹æŽªæ–½ï¼š\n\n1.  **éªŒè¯è¯·æ±‚æ¥æº**ï¼šæ£€æŸ¥è¯·æ±‚IPæˆ–ä½¿ç”¨ç­¾åéªŒè¯\n2.  **ä½¿ç”¨HTTPS**ï¼šç¡®ä¿å›žè°ƒURLä½¿ç”¨HTTPSåè®®\n3.  **å®žçŽ°å¹‚ç­‰æ€§**ï¼šå¤„ç†å¯èƒ½çš„é‡å¤å›žè°ƒ\n4. å›žè°ƒæŽ¥æ”¶ç¤ºä¾‹\n\nä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯ä¸»æµç¼–ç¨‹è¯­è¨€æŽ¥æ”¶å›žè°ƒçš„ç¤ºä¾‹ä»£ç ï¼š\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/vocal-separation-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('æ”¶åˆ°äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»å›žè°ƒ:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // ä»»åŠ¡æˆåŠŸå®Œæˆ\n    console.log('äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»å®Œæˆ');\n    const vocalInfo = data.vocal_removal_info;\n    \n    if (vocalInfo) {\n      console.log('åˆ†ç¦»ç»“æžœ:');\n      console.log(`  åŽŸå§‹éŸ³é¢‘: ${vocalInfo.origin_url}`);\n      \n      // æ ¹æ®ä¸åŒçš„åˆ†ç¦»ç±»åž‹å¤„ç†ä¸åŒçš„æ–‡ä»¶\n      if (vocalInfo.instrumental_url) {\n        // separate_vocal ç±»åž‹\n        console.log(`  çº¯ä¼´å¥: ${vocalInfo.instrumental_url}`);\n        console.log(`  çº¯äººå£°: ${vocalInfo.vocal_url}`);\n      } else {\n        // split_stem ç±»åž‹\n        console.log(`  äººå£°: ${vocalInfo.vocal_url}`);\n        console.log(`  å’Œå£°: ${vocalInfo.backing_vocals_url}`);\n        console.log(`  é¼“å£°: ${vocalInfo.drums_url}`);\n        console.log(`  è´æ–¯: ${vocalInfo.bass_url}`);\n        console.log(`  å‰ä»–: ${vocalInfo.guitar_url}`);\n        console.log(`  é”®ç›˜: ${vocalInfo.keyboard_url}`);\n        console.log(`  æ‰“å‡»ä¹: ${vocalInfo.percussion_url}`);\n        console.log(`  å¼¦ä¹: ${vocalInfo.strings_url}`);\n        console.log(`  åˆæˆå™¨: ${vocalInfo.synth_url}`);\n        console.log(`  éŸ³æ•ˆ: ${vocalInfo.fx_url}`);\n        console.log(`  é“œç®¡ä¹: ${vocalInfo.brass_url}`);\n        console.log(`  æœ¨ç®¡ä¹: ${vocalInfo.woodwinds_url}`);\n      }\n      \n      // ä¸‹è½½åˆ†ç¦»åŽçš„éŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶\n      const https = require('https');\n      const fs = require('fs');\n      \n      const downloadFile = (url, filename) => {\n        if (!url) return;\n        \n        const file = fs.createWriteStream(filename);\n        https.get(url, (response) => {\n          response.pipe(file);\n          file.on('finish', () => {\n            file.close();\n            console.log(`å·²ä¿å­˜: ${filename}`);\n          });\n        }).on('error', (err) => {\n          console.error(`ä¸‹è½½å¤±è´¥ ${filename}:`, err.message);\n        });\n      };\n      \n      // ä¸‹è½½æ‰€æœ‰å¯ç”¨çš„éŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶\n      Object.keys(vocalInfo).forEach(key => {\n        if (vocalInfo[key] && key.endsWith('_url')) {\n          const filename = `${data.task_id}_${key.replace('_url', '')}.mp3`;\n          downloadFile(vocalInfo[key], filename);\n        }\n      });\n    }\n    \n  } else {\n    // ä»»åŠ¡å¤±è´¥\n    console.log('äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»å¤±è´¥:', msg);\n    \n    // å¤„ç†å¤±è´¥æƒ…å†µ...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('å‚æ•°é”™è¯¯æˆ–éŸ³é¢‘æ ¼å¼ä¸æ”¯æŒ');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('æºéŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶ä¸‹è½½å¤±è´¥');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('æœåŠ¡å™¨å†…éƒ¨é”™è¯¯');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // è¿”å›ž200çŠ¶æ€ç ç¡®è®¤æ”¶åˆ°å›žè°ƒ\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('å›žè°ƒæœåŠ¡å™¨è¿è¡Œåœ¨ç«¯å£ 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/vocal-separation-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    vocal_info = callback_data.get('vocal_removal_info')\n    \n    print(f\"æ”¶åˆ°äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»å›žè°ƒ: {task_id}, çŠ¶æ€: {code}, æ¶ˆæ¯: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # ä»»åŠ¡æˆåŠŸå®Œæˆ\n        print(\"äººå£°åˆ†ç¦»å®Œæˆ\")\n        \n        if vocal_info:\n            print(\"åˆ†ç¦»ç»“æžœ:\")\n            print(f\"  åŽŸå§‹éŸ³é¢‘: {vocal_info.get('origin_url')}\")\n            \n            # æ ¹æ®ä¸åŒçš„åˆ†ç¦»ç±»åž‹å¤„ç†ä¸åŒçš„æ–‡ä»¶\n            if vocal_info.get('instrumental_url'):\n                # separate_vocal ç±»åž‹\n                print(f\"  çº¯ä¼´å¥: {vocal_info.get('instrumental_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  çº¯äººå£°: {vocal_info.get('vocal_url')}\")\n            else:\n                # split_stem ç±»åž‹\n                print(f\"  äººå£°: {vocal_info.get('vocal_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  å’Œå£°: {vocal_info.get('backing_vocals_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  é¼“å£°: {vocal_info.get('drums_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  è´æ–¯: {vocal_info.get('bass_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  å‰ä»–: {vocal_info.get('guitar_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  é”®ç›˜: {vocal_info.get('keyboard_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  æ‰“å‡»ä¹: {vocal_info.get('percussion_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  å¼¦ä¹: {vocal_info.get('strings_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  åˆæˆå™¨: {vocal_info.get('synth_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  éŸ³æ•ˆ: {vocal_info.get('fx_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  é“œç®¡ä¹: {vocal_info.get('brass_url')}\")\n                print(f\"  æœ¨ç®¡ä¹: {vocal_info.get('woodwinds_url')}\")\n            \n            # ä¸‹è½½åˆ†ç¦»åŽçš„éŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶\n            def download_file(url, filename):\n                if not url:\n                    return\n                    \n                try:\n                    response = requests.get(url)\n                    if response.status_code == 200:\n                        with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                            f.write(response.content)\n                        print(f\"å·²ä¿å­˜: {filename}\")\n                except Exception as e:\n                    print(f\"ä¸‹è½½å¤±è´¥ {filename}: {e}\")\n            \n            # ä¸‹è½½æ‰€æœ‰å¯ç”¨çš„éŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶\n            for key, url in vocal_info.items():\n                if url and key.endswith('_url'):\n                    filename = Whether itâ€™s remote file migration, large file transmission, or quick small file uploads, our API offers the best solutions for your requirements.\n\n## Authentication\n\nAll API requests require authentication using Bearer tokens. Please obtain your API key from the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key).\n\n### API Base URL\n\n```\nhttps://sunoapiorg.redpandaai.co\n```\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n## Quick Start Guide\n\n### Step 1: Choose Your Upload Method\n\nSelect the appropriate upload method based on your needs:\n\n*   URL File Upload\n    \n*   File Stream Upload\n    \n*   Base64 Upload\n    \n\nSuitable for downloading and uploading files from remote servers:\n\nSuitable for directly uploading local files, especially large files:\n\nSuitable for Base64 encoded file data:\n\n### Step 2: Handle Response\n\nUpon successful upload, youâ€™ll receive a response containing file information:\n\n```\n{\n  \"success\": true,\n  \"code\": 200,\n  \"msg\": \"File uploaded successfully\",\n  \"data\": {\n    \"fileId\": \"file_abc123456\",\n    \"fileName\": \"my-image.jpg\",\n    \"originalName\": \"sample-image.jpg\",\n    \"fileSize\": 245760,\n    \"mimeType\": \"image/jpeg\",\n    \"uploadPath\": \"images\",\n    \"fileUrl\": \"https://sunoapiorg.redpandaai.co/files/images/my-image.jpg\",\n    \"downloadUrl\": \"https://sunoapiorg.redpandaai.co/download/file_abc123456\",\n    \"uploadTime\": \"2025-01-15T10:30:00Z\",\n    \"expiresAt\": \"2025-01-18T10:30:00Z\"\n  }\n}\n```\n\n## Upload Method Comparison\n\nChoose the most suitable upload method for your needs:\n\n## Practical Examples\n\n### Batch File Upload\n\nUsing file stream upload to handle multiple files:\n\n*   JavaScript\n    \n*   Python\n    \n\n```\nclass FileUploadAPI {\n  constructor(apiKey) {\n    this.apiKey = apiKey;\n    this.baseUrl = 'https://sunoapiorg.redpandaai.co';\n  }\n  \n  async uploadFile(file, uploadPath = '', fileName = null) {\n    const formData = new FormData();\n    formData.append('file', file);\n    if (uploadPath) formData.append('uploadPath', uploadPath);\n    if (fileName) formData.append('fileName', fileName);\n    \n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/api/file-stream-upload`, {\n      method: 'POST',\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`\n      },\n      body: formData\n    });\n    \n    if (!response.ok) {\n      throw new Error(`Upload failed: ${response.statusText}`);\n    }\n    \n    return response.json();\n  }\n  \n  async uploadFromUrl(fileUrl, uploadPath = '', fileName = null) {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/api/file-url-upload`, {\n      method: 'POST',\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`,\n        'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n      },\n      body: JSON.stringify({\n        fileUrl,\n        uploadPath,\n        fileName\n      })\n    });\n    \n    if (!response.ok) {\n      throw new Error(`Upload failed: ${response.statusText}`);\n    }\n    \n    return response.json();\n  }\n  \n  async uploadBase64(base64Data, uploadPath = '', fileName = null) {\n    const response = await fetch(`${this.baseUrl}/api/file-base64-upload`, {\n      method: 'POST',\n      headers: {\n        'Authorization': `Bearer ${this.apiKey}`,\n        'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n      },\n      body: JSON.stringify({\n        base64Data,\n        uploadPath,\n        fileName\n      })\n    });\n    \n    if (!response.ok) {\n      throw new Error(`Upload failed: ${response.statusText}`);\n    }\n    \n    return response.json();\n  }\n}\n\n// Usage example\nconst uploader = new FileUploadAPI('YOUR_API_KEY');\n\n// Batch upload files\nasync function uploadMultipleFiles(files) {\n  const results = [];\n  \n  for (let i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {\n    try {\n      const result = await uploader.uploadFile(\n        files[i], \n        'user-uploads', \n        `file-${i + 1}-${files[i].name}`\n      );\n      results.push(result);\n      console.log(`File ${i + 1} uploaded successfully:`, result.data.fileUrl);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(`File ${i + 1} upload failed:`, error.message);\n    }\n  }\n  \n  return results;\n}\n\n// Batch upload from URLs\nasync function uploadFromUrls(urls) {\n  const results = [];\n  \n  for (let i = 0; i < urls.length; i++) {\n    try {\n      const result = await uploader.uploadFromUrl(\n        urls[i], \n        'downloads', \n        `download-${i + 1}.jpg`\n      );\n      results.push(result);\n      console.log(`URL ${i + 1} uploaded successfully:`, result.data.fileUrl);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(`URL ${i + 1} upload failed:`, error.message);\n    }\n  }\n  \n  return results;\n}\n```\n\n```\nimport requests\nimport base64\nimport os\nfrom typing import List, Optional\n\nclass FileUploadAPI:\n    def __init__(self, api_key: str):\n        self.api_key = api_key\n        self.base_url = 'https://sunoapiorg.redpandaai.co'\n        self.headers = {\n            'Authorization': f'Bearer {api_key}'\n        }\n    \n    def upload_file(self, file_path: str, upload_path: str = '', \n                   file_name: Optional[str] = None) -> dict:\n        \"\"\"File stream upload\"\"\"\n        files = {\n            'file': (os.path.basename(file_path), open(file_path, 'rb'))\n        }\n        \n        data = {}\n        if upload_path:\n            data['uploadPath'] = upload_path\n        if file_name:\n            data['fileName'] = file_name\n        \n        response = requests.post(\n            f'{self.base_url}/api/file-stream-upload',\n            headers=self.headers,\n            files=files,\n            data=data\n        )\n        \n        if not response.ok:\n            raise Exception(f'Upload failed: {response.text}')\n        \n        return response.json()\n    \n    def upload_from_url(self, file_url: str, upload_path: str = '', \n                       file_name: Optional[str] = None) -> dict:\n        \"\"\"URL file upload\"\"\"\n        payload = {\n            'fileUrl': file_url,\n            'uploadPath': upload_path,\n            'fileName': file_name\n        }\n        \n        response = requests.post(\n            f'{self.base_url}/api/file-url-upload',\n            headers={**self.headers, 'Content-Type': 'application/json'},\n            json=payload\n        )\n        \n        if not response.ok:\n            raise Exception(f'Upload failed: {response.text}')\n        \n        return response.json()\n    \n    def upload_base64(self, base64_data: str, upload_path: str = '', \n                     file_name: Optional[str] = None) -> dict:\n        \"\"\"Base64 file upload\"\"\"\n        payload = {\n            'base64Data': base64_data,\n            'uploadPath': upload_path,\n            'fileName': file_name\n        }\n        \n        response = requests.post(\n            f'{self.base_url}/api/file-base64-upload',\n            headers={**self.headers, 'Content-Type': 'application/json'},\n            json=payload\n        )\n        \n        if not response.ok:\n            raise Exception(f'Upload failed: {response.text}')\n        \n        return response.json()\n\n# Usage example\ndef main():\n    uploader = FileUploadAPI('YOUR_API_KEY')\n    \n    # Batch upload local files\n    file_paths = [\n        '/path/to/file1.jpg',\n        '/path/to/file2.png',\n        '/path/to/document.pdf'\n    ]\n    \n    print(\"Starting batch file upload...\")\n    for i, file_path in enumerate(file_paths):\n        try:\n            result = uploader.upload_file(\n                file_path, \n                'user-uploads', \n                f'file-{i + 1}-{os.path.basename(file_path)}'\n            )\n            print(f\"File {i + 1} uploaded successfully: {result['data']['fileUrl']}\")\n        except Exception as e:\n            print(f\"File {i + 1} upload failed: {e}\")\n    \n    # Batch upload from URLs\n    urls = [\n        'https://example.com/image1.jpg',\n        'https://example.com/image2.png'\n    ]\n    \n    print(\"\\nStarting batch URL upload...\")\n    for i, url in enumerate(urls):\n        try:\n            result = uploader.upload_from_url(\n                url, \n                'downloads', \n                f'download-{i + 1}.jpg'\n            )\n            print(f\"URL {i + 1} uploaded successfully: {result['data']['fileUrl']}\")\n        except Exception as e:\n            print(f\"URL {i + 1} upload failed: {e}\")\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    main()\n```\n\n## Error Handling\n\nCommon errors and handling methods:\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## File Storage Information\n\n*   Files are immediately accessible and downloadable after upload\n*   File URLs remain valid for 3 days\n*   The system provides an `expiresAt` field in the response indicating expiration time\n*   Itâ€™s recommended to download or migrate important files before expiration\n*   Use the `downloadUrl` field to get direct download links\n\n## Status Codes\n\n200\n\nSuccess\n\nRequest processed successfully, file upload completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request\n\nRequest parameters are incorrect or missing required parameters\n\n401\n\nUnauthorized\n\nAuthentication credentials are missing or invalid\n\n405\n\nMethod Not Allowed\n\nRequest method is not supported, please check HTTP method\n\n500\n\nServer Error\n\nAn unexpected error occurred while processing the request, please retry or contact support\n\n## Next Steps\n\n## Support\n\n---\n\nReady to start uploading files? \"https://example.com/music.mp3\",\n  \"title\": \"Relaxing Piano\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Heavy Metal, Aggressive Drums\",\n  \"tags\": \"Relaxing Piano, Ambient, Peaceful\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.61,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.72,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"model\": Capabilities**\n\n*   Accepts uploadUrl of an existing audio file (usually vocals or stems).\n*   Supports fine-grained customization via parameters such as:\n    *   tags and negativeTags (musical style controls)\n    *   styleWeight, audioWeight, weirdnessConstraint (stylistic & creative blending)\n    *   vocalGender, title, callBackUrl for metadata & workflow controlÂ  .\n*   Returns a taskId for tracking, and results are retained for 14 days. Callback workflow includes three stages: text, first, and completeÂ  .\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#typical-use-cases)\n\n**Typical Use Cases**\n\n*   Singers or melody writers who want instant fuller arrangements around their vocal inputs.\n*   Applications like karaoke platforms, demo-generation tools, or co-creation interfaces that allow users to experiment with accompaniment styles easily.\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#parameter-usage-guide)\n\nParameter Usage Guide\n\nRequired parameters for all requests:\n\n*   `uploadUrl`: Valid audio file URL (MP3, WAV, or other supported formats)\n*   `title`: Title for the generated instrumental track (max 100 characters)\n*   `tags`: Desired style and characteristics for the instrumental\n*   `negativeTags`: Styles or instruments to exclude\n*   `callBackUrl`: URL to receive completion notifications\n\nOptional parameters for enhanced control:\n\n*   `vocalGender`: Preferred vocal gender for any vocal elements (â€˜mâ€™ or â€˜fâ€™)\n*   `styleWeight`: Style adherence weight (0.00-1.00)\n*   `weirdnessConstraint`: Creativity/novelty constraint (0.00-1.00)\n*   `audioWeight`: Audio consistency weight (0.00-1.00)\n*   `model`: Model version used for generation. Allowed values: `V4_5PLUS` (default), `V5`\n\nAudio requirements:\n\n*   File Format: MP3, WAV, or other supported audio formats\n*   Quality: Higher quality input generally produces better instrumental results\n*   Accessibility: Ensure uploaded audio URLs are publicly accessible and stable\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#developer-notes)\n\nDeveloper Notes\n\n1.  Generated instrumental files are retained for 15 days before being deleted\n2.  Ensure you have proper rights to use the uploaded audio content\n3.  Be specific with tags to get the desired instrumental style (e.g., â€œacoustic guitar, soft piano, ambientâ€)\n4.  Use negative tags effectively to avoid unwanted elements\n5.  Callback process has three stages: text (text generation), first (first track complete), complete (all tracks complete)\n6.  You can use the Get Music Generation Details endpoint to actively check task status instead of waiting for callbacks\n\n#### Authorizations\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#authorization-authorization)\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n# ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\nThe URL of the uploaded music file to add instrumental to.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Must be a valid audio file URL accessible by the system.\n*   The uploaded audio should be in a supported format (MP3, WAV, etc.).\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://example.com/music.mp3\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-title)\n\ntitle\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe title of the music track.\n\n*   Required.\n*   This will be used as the title for the generated instrumental track.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Relaxing Piano\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-negative-tags)\n\nnegativeTags\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nMusic styles or traits to exclude from the generated instrumental.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Use to avoid specific styles or instruments in the instrumental version.  \n    Example: \"Heavy Metal, Aggressive Drums\"\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Heavy Metal, Aggressive Drums\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-tags)\n\ntags\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nMusic style and characteristics for the instrumental.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Describe the desired style, mood, and instruments for the instrumental track.  \n    Example: \"Relaxing Piano, Ambient, Peaceful\"\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Relaxing Piano, Ambient, Peaceful\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-call-back-url)\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive task completion notifications when instrumental generation is complete. The callback process has three stages: `text` (text generation), `first` (first track complete), `complete` (all tracks complete). Note: In some cases, `text` and `first` stages may be skipped, directly returning `complete`.\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Add Instrumental Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/add-instrumental-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the Get Music Generation Details interface to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-vocal-gender)\n\nvocalGender\n\nenum<string>\n\nPreferred vocal gender for any vocal elements. Optional. Allowed values: 'm' (male), 'f' (female).\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`m`,\n\n`f`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"m\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style-weight)\n\nstyleWeight\n\nnumber\n\nStyle adherence weight. Optional. Range: 0-1. Two decimal places recommended.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.61`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-weirdness-constraint)\n\nweirdnessConstraint\n\nnumber\n\nCreativity/novelty constraint. Optional. Range: 0-1. Two decimal places recommended.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.72`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-audio-weight)\n\naudioWeight\n\nnumber\n\nRelative weight of audio consistency versus other controls. Optional. Range: 0-1. Two decimal places recommended.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-model)\n\nmodel\n\nenum<string>\n\ndefault:V4\\_5PLUS\n\nModel version to use for generation. Optional. Default: V4\\_5PLUS.\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`V4_5PLUS`,\n\n`V5`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"V4_5PLUS\"`\n\n#### Response\n\n200\n\napplication/json\n\nRequest successful\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-code)\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n# Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nExample:\n\n`200`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-msg)\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-data)\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Upload and Extend Audio Callbacks](/suno-api/upload-and-extend-audio-callbacks)[Add Instrumental Callbacks](/suno-api/add-instrumental-callbacks)",

"Content": "## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/add-instrumental-callbacks\n\n# Add Instrumental Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Add Instrumental API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Instrumental generation task completed successfully\n*   Instrumental generation task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Instrumental generation completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, content violation, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download related files\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.callbackType\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nCallback type indicating the current callback stage:\n\n*   `text`: Text generation completed\n*   `first`: First track completed\n*   `complete`: All tracks completed\n*   `error`: Task failed\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.data\n\narray\n\nInstrumental generation result information, returned on success\n\ndata.data\\[\\].id\n\nstring\n\nAudio unique identifier (audioId)\n\ndata.data\\[\\].audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nGenerated instrumental audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal instrumental audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nStreaming instrumental audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal streaming instrumental audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nCover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal cover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].prompt\n\nstring\n\nGeneration prompt describing the instrumental\n\ndata.data\\[\\].model\\_name\n\nstring\n\nModel name used for generation\n\ndata.data\\[\\].title\n\nstring\n\nInstrumental track title\n\ndata.data\\[\\].tags\n\nstring\n\nInstrumental track tags\n\ndata.data\\[\\].createTime\n\nstring\n\nCreation time\n\ndata.data\\[\\].duration\n\nnumber\n\nAudio duration (seconds)\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/add-instrumental-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received instrumental generation callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    callbackType: data.callbackType,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Instrumental generation completed');\n    const instrumentalData = data.data || [];\n    \n    console.log(`Generated ${instrumentalData.length} instrumental tracks:`);\n    instrumentalData.forEach((instrumental, index) => {\n      console.log(`Instrumental ${index + 1}:`);\n      console.log(`  Title: ${instrumental.title}`);\n      console.log(`  Duration: ${instrumental.duration} seconds`);\n      console.log(`  Tags: ${instrumental.tags}`);\n      console.log(`  Audio URL: ${instrumental.audio_url}`);\n      console.log(`  Cover URL: ${instrumental.image_url}`);\n    });\n    \n    // Process generated instrumental\n    // Can download audio files, save locally, etc.\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Instrumental generation failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or content violation');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('File download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/add-instrumental-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    callback_type = callback_data.get('callbackType')\n    instrumental_data = callback_data.get('data', [])\n    \n    print(f\"Received instrumental generation callback: {task_id}, type: {callback_type}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Instrumental generation completed\")\n        \n        print(f\"Generated {len(instrumental_data)} instrumental tracks:\")\n        for i, instrumental in enumerate(instrumental_data):\n            print(f\"Instrumental {i + 1}:\")\n            print(f\"  Title: {instrumental.get('title')}\")\n            print(f\"  Duration: {instrumental.get('duration')} seconds\")\n            print(f\"  Tags: {instrumental.get('tags')}\")\n            print(f\"  Audio URL: {instrumental.get('audio_url')}\")\n            print(f\"  Cover URL: {instrumental.get('image_url')}\")\n            \n            # Download audio file example\n            try:\n                audio_url = instrumental.get('audio_url')\n                if audio_url:\n                    response = requests.get(audio_url)\n                    if response.status_code == 200:\n                        filename = f\"generated_instrumental_{task_id}_{i + 1}.mp3\"\n                        with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                            f.write(response.content)\n                        print(f\"Instrumental saved as {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"Audio download failed: {e}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Instrumental generation failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or content violation\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"File download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$callbackType = $callbackData['callbackType'] ?? '';\n$instrumentalData = $callbackData['data'] ?? [];\n\nerror_log(\"Received instrumental generation callback: $taskId, type: $callbackType, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Instrumental generation completed\");\n    \n    error_log(\"Generated \" . count($instrumentalData) . \" instrumental tracks:\");\n    foreach ($instrumentalData as $index => $instrumental) {\n        error_log(\"Instrumental \" . ($index + 1) . \":\");\n        error_log(\"  Title: \" . ($instrumental['title'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Duration: \" . ($instrumental['duration'] ?? 0) . \" seconds\");\n        error_log(\"  Tags: \" . ($instrumental['tags'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Audio URL: \" . ($instrumental['audio_url'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Cover URL: \" . ($instrumental['image_url'] ?? ''));\n        \n        // Download audio file example\n        try {\n            $audioUrl = $instrumental['audio_url'] ?? '';\n            if ($audioUrl) {\n                $audioContent = file_get_contents($audioUrl);\n                if ($audioContent !== false) {\n                    $filename = \"generated_instrumental_{$taskId}_\" . ($index + 1) . \".mp3\";\n                    file_put_contents($filename, $audioContent);\n                    error_log(\"Instrumental saved as $filename\");\n                }\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"Audio download failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Instrumental generation failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or content violation\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"File download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get music generation details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-music-generation-details)",

Piano with Vocals\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Heavy Metal, Aggressive Vocals\",\n  \"style\": \"Jazz\",\n  \"uploadUrl\": \"https://example.com/instrumental.mp3\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"Relaxing Piano with Vocals\",\n  \"negativeTags\": \"Heavy Metal, Aggressive Vocals\",\n  \"style\": \"Jazz\",\n  \"uploadUrl\": \"https://example.com/instrumental.mp3\",\n  \"callBackUrl\": \"https://api.example.com/callback\",\n  \"vocalGender\": \"m\",\n  \"styleWeight\": 0.61,\n  \"weirdnessConstraint\": 0.72,\n  \"audioWeight\": 0.65,\n  \"model\": Capabilities**\n\n*   Accepts an existing instrumental via uploadUrl, with optional prompt-based stylistic input.\n*   Supports control parameters including:\n    *   prompt, style, tags, negativeTags (define lyrical content and vocal style)\n    *   vocalGender, styleWeight, weirdnessConstraint, audioWeight, callBackUrlÂ  .\n*   Returns a taskId, supports the same 14-day retention and three-stage callback model as the instrumental endpointÂ  .\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#typical-use-cases)\n\n**Typical Use Cases**\n\n*   Music platforms or tools enabling topline creation and rapid prototyping of lyrical ideas.\n*   Collaborative songwriting or co-creation workflows, where lyrics or vocal styles are iteratively tested over instrumental drafts.\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#parameter-usage-guide)\n\nParameter Usage Guide\n\nRequired parameters for all requests:\n\n*   `uploadUrl`: Valid instrumental audio file URL\n*   `prompt`: Description of the desired vocal content and style\n*   `title`: Title for the generated vocal track (max 100 characters)\n*   `style`: Music and vocal style (e.g., â€œJazzâ€, â€œPopâ€, â€œClassicalâ€)\n*   `negativeTags`: Vocal styles or characteristics to exclude\n*   `callBackUrl`: URL to receive completion notifications\n\nOptional parameters for enhanced control:\n\n*   `vocalGender`: Preferred vocal gender (â€˜mâ€™ for male, â€˜fâ€™ for female)\n*   `styleWeight`: Style adherence weight (0.00-1.00)\n*   `weirdnessConstraint`: Creativity/novelty constraint (0.00-1.00)\n*   `audioWeight`: Audio consistency weight (0.00-1.00)\n*   `model`: Model version used for generation. Allowed values: `V4_5PLUS` (default), `V5`\n\nAudio requirements:\n\n*   Input Type: Instrumental or backing track audio files\n*   File Format: MP3, WAV, or other supported audio formats\n*   Quality: Clear instrumental tracks work best for vocal addition\n*   Accessibility: Ensure uploaded audio URLs are publicly accessible\n\n### \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#developer-notes)\n\nDeveloper Notes\n\n1.  Generated vocal tracks are retained for 15 days before being deleted\n2.  Ensure you have proper rights to use the uploaded audio content\n3.  Use clear, well-mixed instrumental tracks for best results\n4.  Be specific about vocal style in your prompt (e.g., â€œsmooth jazz vocalsâ€, â€œenergetic pop vocalsâ€)\n5.  Callback process has three stages: text (text generation), first (first track complete), complete (all tracks complete)\n6.  You can use the Get Music Generation Details endpoint to actively check task status instead of waiting for callbacks\n\n#### Authorizations\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#authorization-authorization)\n\nAuthorization\n\nstring\n\nheader\n\nrequired\n\n# ðŸ”‘ API Authentication\n\nAll endpoints require authentication using Bearer Token.\n\n## Get API Key\n\n1.  Visit the [API Key Management Page](https://sunoapi.org/api-key) to obtain your API Key\n\n## Usage\n\nAdd to request headers:\n\n```\nAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY\n```\n\n> âš ï¸ Note:\n> \n> *   Keep your API Key secure and do not share it with others\n> *   If you suspect your API Key has been compromised, reset it immediately from the management page\n\n#### Body\n\napplication/json\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-prompt)\n\nprompt\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nDescription of the audio content to generate vocals for.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Provides context about the desired vocal style and content.\n*   The more detailed your prompt, the better the vocal generation will match your vision.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"A calm and relaxing piano track with soothing vocals\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-title)\n\ntitle\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe title of the music track.\n\n*   Required.\n*   This will be used as the title for the generated vocal track.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Relaxing Piano with Vocals\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-negative-tags)\n\nnegativeTags\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nMusic styles or vocal traits to exclude from the generated track.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Use to avoid specific vocal styles or characteristics.  \n    Example: \"Heavy Metal, Aggressive Vocals\"\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Heavy Metal, Aggressive Vocals\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style)\n\nstyle\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nThe music and vocal style.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Examples: \"Jazz\", \"Classical\", \"Electronic\", \"Pop\".\n*   Describes the overall genre and vocal approach.\n\nExample:\n\n`\"Jazz\"`\n\nThe URL of the uploaded audio file to add vocals to.\n\n*   Required.\n*   Must be a valid audio file URL accessible by the system.\n*   The uploaded audio should be in a supported format (MP3, WAV, etc.).\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://example.com/instrumental.mp3\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-call-back-url)\n\ncallBackUrl\n\nstring<uri>\n\nrequired\n\nThe URL to receive task completion notifications when vocal generation is complete. The callback process has three stages: `text` (text generation), `first` (first track complete), `complete` (all tracks complete). Note: In some cases, `text` and `first` stages may be skipped, directly returning `complete`.\n\nFor detailed callback format and implementation guide, see [Add Vocals Callbacks](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/add-vocals-callbacks)\n\n*   Alternatively, you can use the Get Music Generation Details interface to poll task status\n\nExample:\n\n`\"https://api.example.com/callback\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-vocal-gender)\n\nvocalGender\n\nenum<string>\n\nPreferred vocal gender. Optional. Allowed values: 'm' (male), 'f' (female).\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`m`,\n\n`f`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"m\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-style-weight)\n\nstyleWeight\n\nnumber\n\nStyle adherence weight. Optional. Range: 0-1. Two decimal places recommended.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.61`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-weirdness-constraint)\n\nweirdnessConstraint\n\nnumber\n\nCreativity/novelty constraint. Optional. Range: 0-1. Two decimal places recommended.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.72`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-audio-weight)\n\naudioWeight\n\nnumber\n\nRelative weight of audio consistency versus other controls. Optional. Range: 0-1. Two decimal places recommended.\n\nRequired range: `0 <= x <= 1`Must be a multiple of `0.01`\n\nExample:\n\n`0.65`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#body-model)\n\nmodel\n\nenum<string>\n\ndefault:V4\\_5PLUS\n\nModel version to use for generation. Optional. Default: V4\\_5PLUS.\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`V4_5PLUS`,\n\n`V5`\n\nExample:\n\n`\"V4_5PLUS\"`\n\n#### Response\n\n200\n\napplication/json\n\nRequest successful\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-code)\n\ncode\n\nenum<integer>\n\n# Status Codes\n\n*   âœ… 200 - Request successful\n*   âš ï¸ 400 - Invalid parameters\n*   âš ï¸ 401 - Unauthorized access\n*   âš ï¸ 404 - Invalid request method or path\n*   âš ï¸ 405 - Rate limit exceeded\n*   âš ï¸ 413 - Theme or prompt too long\n*   âš ï¸ 429 - Insufficient credits\n*   âš ï¸ 430 - Your call frequency is too high. Please try again later.\n*   âš ï¸ 455 - System maintenance\n*   âŒ 500 - Server error\n\nAvailable options:\n\n`200`,\n\n`400`,\n\n`401`,\n\n`404`,\n\n`405`,\n\n`413`,\n\n`429`,\n\n`430`,\n\n`455`,\n\n`500`\n\nExample:\n\n`200`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-msg)\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nError message when code != 200\n\nExample:\n\n`\"success\"`\n\n[â€‹\n\n](#response-data)\n\ndata\n\nobject\n\nShow child attributes\n\n[Add Instrumental Callbacks](/suno-api/add-instrumental-callbacks)[Add Vocals Callbacks](/suno-api/add-vocals-callbacks)",

"Content": "## Source: https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/add-vocals-callbacks\n\n# Add Vocals Callbacks - Suno API\n\nWhen you submit a task to the Add Vocals API, you can use the `callBackUrl` parameter to set a callback URL. When the task is completed, the system will automatically push the results to your specified address.\n\n## Callback Mechanism Overview\n\n### Callback Timing\n\nThe system will send callback notifications in the following situations:\n\n*   Vocal generation task completed successfully\n*   Vocal generation task failed\n*   Errors occurred during task processing\n\n### Callback Method\n\n*   **HTTP Method**: POST\n*   **Content Type**: application/json\n*   **Timeout Setting**: 15 seconds\n\n## Callback Request Format\n\nWhen the task is completed, the system will send a POST request to your `callBackUrl` in the following format:\n\n## Status Code Description\n\ncode\n\ninteger\n\nrequired\n\nCallback status code indicating task processing result:\n\nStatus Code\n\nDescription\n\n200\n\nSuccess - Vocal generation completed\n\n400\n\nBad Request - Parameter error, content violation, etc.\n\n451\n\nDownload Failed - Unable to download related files\n\n500\n\nServer Error - Please try again later\n\nmsg\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nStatus message providing detailed status description\n\ndata.callbackType\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nCallback type indicating the current callback stage:\n\n*   `text`: Text generation completed\n*   `first`: First track completed\n*   `complete`: All tracks completed\n*   `error`: Task failed\n\ndata.task\\_id\n\nstring\n\nrequired\n\nTask ID, consistent with the taskId returned when you submitted the task\n\ndata.data\n\narray\n\nVocal generation result information, returned on success\n\ndata.data\\[\\].id\n\nstring\n\nAudio unique identifier (audioId)\n\ndata.data\\[\\].audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nGenerated vocal audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal vocal audio file URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nStreaming vocal audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_stream\\_audio\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal streaming vocal audio URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nCover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].source\\_image\\_url\n\nstring\n\nOriginal cover image URL\n\ndata.data\\[\\].prompt\n\nstring\n\nGeneration prompt/lyrics describing the vocals\n\ndata.data\\[\\].model\\_name\n\nstring\n\nModel name used for generation\n\ndata.data\\[\\].title\n\nstring\n\nVocal track title\n\ndata.data\\[\\].tags\n\nstring\n\nVocal track tags\n\ndata.data\\[\\].createTime\n\nstring\n\nCreation time\n\ndata.data\\[\\].duration\n\nnumber\n\nAudio duration (seconds)\n\n## Callback Reception Examples\n\nHere are example codes for receiving callbacks in popular programming languages:\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/add-vocals-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('Received vocal generation callback:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    callbackType: data.callbackType,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    console.log('Vocal generation completed');\n    const vocalData = data.data || [];\n    \n    console.log(`Generated ${vocalData.length} vocal tracks:`);\n    vocalData.forEach((vocal, index) => {\n      console.log(`Vocal ${index + 1}:`);\n      console.log(`  Title: ${vocal.title}`);\n      console.log(`  Duration: ${vocal.duration} seconds`);\n      console.log(`  Tags: ${vocal.tags}`);\n      console.log(`  Audio URL: ${vocal.audio_url}`);\n      console.log(`  Cover URL: ${vocal.image_url}`);\n    });\n    \n    // Process generated vocals\n    // Can download audio files, save locally, etc.\n    \n  } else {\n    // Task failed\n    console.log('Vocal generation failed:', msg);\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if (code === 400) {\n      console.log('Parameter error or content violation');\n    } else if (code === 451) {\n      console.log('File download failed');\n    } else if (code === 500) {\n      console.log('Server internal error');\n    }\n  }\n  \n  // Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n  res.status(200).json({ status: 'received' });\n});\n\napp.listen(3000, () => {\n  console.log('Callback server running on port 3000');\n});\n```\n\n```\nfrom flask import Flask, request, jsonify\nimport requests\n\napp = Flask(__name__)\n\n@app.route('/add-vocals-callback', methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id = callback_data.get('task_id')\n    callback_type = callback_data.get('callbackType')\n    vocal_data = callback_data.get('data', [])\n    \n    print(f\"Received vocal generation callback: {task_id}, type: {callback_type}, status: {code}, message: {msg}\")\n    \n    if code == 200:\n        # Task completed successfully\n        print(\"Vocal generation completed\")\n        \n        print(f\"Generated {len(vocal_data)} vocal tracks:\")\n        for i, vocal in enumerate(vocal_data):\n            print(f\"Vocal {i + 1}:\")\n            print(f\"  Title: {vocal.get('title')}\")\n            print(f\"  Duration: {vocal.get('duration')} seconds\")\n            print(f\"  Tags: {vocal.get('tags')}\")\n            print(f\"  Audio URL: {vocal.get('audio_url')}\")\n            print(f\"  Cover URL: {vocal.get('image_url')}\")\n            \n            # Download audio file example\n            try:\n                audio_url = vocal.get('audio_url')\n                if audio_url:\n                    response = requests.get(audio_url)\n                    if response.status_code == 200:\n                        filename = f\"generated_vocal_{task_id}_{i + 1}.mp3\"\n                        with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                            f.write(response.content)\n                        print(f\"Vocal saved as {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n                print(f\"Audio download failed: {e}\")\n                \n    else:\n        # Task failed\n        print(f\"Vocal generation failed: {msg}\")\n        \n        # Handle failure cases...\n        if code == 400:\n            print(\"Parameter error or content violation\")\n        elif code == 451:\n            print(\"File download failed\")\n        elif code == 500:\n            print(\"Server internal error\")\n    \n    # Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\n    return jsonify({'status': 'received'}), 200\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=3000)\n```\n\n```\n<?php\nheader('Content-Type: application/json');\n\n// Get POST data\n$input = file_get_contents('php://input');\n$data = json_decode($input, true);\n\n$code = $data['code'] ?? null;\n$msg = $data['msg'] ?? '';\n$callbackData = $data['data'] ?? [];\n$taskId = $callbackData['task_id'] ?? '';\n$callbackType = $callbackData['callbackType'] ?? '';\n$vocalData = $callbackData['data'] ?? [];\n\nerror_log(\"Received vocal generation callback: $taskId, type: $callbackType, status: $code, message: $msg\");\n\nif ($code === 200) {\n    // Task completed successfully\n    error_log(\"Vocal generation completed\");\n    \n    error_log(\"Generated \" . count($vocalData) . \" vocal tracks:\");\n    foreach ($vocalData as $index => $vocal) {\n        error_log(\"Vocal \" . ($index + 1) . \":\");\n        error_log(\"  Title: \" . ($vocal['title'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Duration: \" . ($vocal['duration'] ?? 0) . \" seconds\");\n        error_log(\"  Tags: \" . ($vocal['tags'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Audio URL: \" . ($vocal['audio_url'] ?? ''));\n        error_log(\"  Cover URL: \" . ($vocal['image_url'] ?? ''));\n        \n        // Download audio file example\n        try {\n            $audioUrl = $vocal['audio_url'] ?? '';\n            if ($audioUrl) {\n                $audioContent = file_get_contents($audioUrl);\n                if ($audioContent !== false) {\n                    $filename = \"generated_vocal_{$taskId}_\" . ($index + 1) . \".mp3\";\n                    file_put_contents($filename, $audioContent);\n                    error_log(\"Vocal saved as $filename\");\n                }\n            }\n        } catch (Exception $e) {\n            error_log(\"Audio download failed: \" . $e->getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n} else {\n    // Task failed\n    error_log(\"Vocal generation failed: $msg\");\n    \n    // Handle failure cases...\n    if ($code === 400) {\n        error_log(\"Parameter error or content violation\");\n    } elseif ($code === 451) {\n        error_log(\"File download failed\");\n    } elseif ($code === 500) {\n        error_log(\"Server internal error\");\n    }\n}\n\n// Return 200 status code to confirm callback received\nhttp_response_code(200);\necho json_encode(['status' => 'received']);\n?>\n```\n\n## Best Practices\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\nIf you do not receive callback notifications, please check the following:\n\n## Alternative Solution\n\nIf you cannot use the callback mechanism, you can also use polling:\n\n[\n\n## Poll Query Results\n\nUse the get music generation details endpoint to regularly query task status. We recommend querying every 30 seconds.\n\n\n\n](https://docs.sunoapi.org/suno-api/get-music-generation-details)",

**è¶…æ—¶è®¾ç½®**: 15ç§’\n\n## å›žè°ƒè¯·æ±‚æ ¼å¼\n\nä»»åŠ¡å®Œæˆæ—¶ï¼Œç³»ç»Ÿä¼šå‘æ‚¨çš„ `callBackUrl` å‘é€ä»¥ä¸‹æ ¼å¼çš„POSTè¯·æ±‚ï¼š\n\n## å‚æ•°é”™è¯¯ã€æºéŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶æ ¼å¼ä¸æ”¯æŒç­‰\n\n451\n\nä¸‹è½½å¤±è´¥ - æ— æ³•ä¸‹è½½æºéŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶\n\n500\n\næœåŠ¡å™¨é”™è¯¯ - å›žè°ƒæŽ¥æ”¶ç¤ºä¾‹\n\nä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯ä¸»æµç¼–ç¨‹è¯­è¨€æŽ¥æ”¶å›žè°ƒçš„ç¤ºä¾‹ä»£ç ï¼š\n\n*   Node.js\n    \n*   Python\n    \n*   PHP\n    \n\n```\nconst express = require('express');\nconst app = express();\n\napp.use(express.json());\n\napp.post('/wav-conversion-callback', (req, res) => {\n  const { code, msg, data } = req.body;\n  \n  console.log('æ”¶åˆ°WAVæ ¼å¼è½¬æ¢å›žè°ƒ:', {\n    taskId: data.task_id,\n    status: code,\n    message: msg\n  });\n  \n  if (code === 200) {\n    // ä»»åŠ¡æˆåŠŸå®Œæˆ\n    console.log('WAVæ ¼å¼è½¬æ¢å®Œæˆ');\n    console.log(`WAVæ–‡ä»¶URL: ${data.audioWavUrl}`);\n    \n    // ä¸‹è½½WAVæ–‡ä»¶\n    if (data.audioWavUrl) {\n      const https = require('https');\n      const fs = require('fs');\n      \n      const filename = {\n          file.close();\n          console.log(`WAVæ–‡ä»¶å·²ä¿å­˜ä¸º ${filename}`);\n        });\n      }).on('error', (err) => {\n        console.error('WAVæ–‡ä»¶ä¸‹è½½å¤±è´¥:', err.message);\n methods=['POST'])\ndef handle_callback():\n    data = request.json\n    \n    code = data.get('code')\n    msg = data.get('msg')\n    callback_data = data.get('data', {})\n    task_id =      # ä»»åŠ¡æˆåŠŸå®Œæˆ\n        print(\"WAVæ ¼å¼è½¬æ¢å®Œæˆ\")\n        print(f\"WAVæ–‡ä»¶URL: {audioWavUrl}\")\n        \n        # ä¸‹è½½WAVæ–‡ä»¶ç¤ºä¾‹\n        if audioWavUrl:\n            try:\n                response = requests.get(audioWavUrl)\n                if response.status_code == 200:\n                    filename = f\"wav_{task_id}.wav\"\n                    with open(filename, \"wb\") as f:\n                        f.write(response.content)\n                    print(f\"WAVæ–‡ä»¶å·²ä¿å­˜ä¸º {filename}\")\n            except Exception as e:\n \n\n[â€‹\n\n](#ç”¨æ³•æŒ‡å—)\n\nç”¨æ³•æŒ‡å—\n\n*   æ­¤æŽ¥å£ä¸ºæ‚¨çš„éŸ³ä¹æ›²ç›®åˆ›å»ºMP4è§†é¢‘æ ¼å¼çš„å¯è§†åŒ–è¡¨ç¤ºã€‚\n*   éœ€è¦åŒæ—¶æä¾› `taskId` å’Œ `audioId` æ¥è¯†åˆ«å…·ä½“æ›²ç›®ã€‚\n*   å¯é€‰çš„
